reviews/0/text:
We parked at the funicular and took it to the top. It was interesting to ride the oldest operational funicular on the Iberian Peninsula. The ride is only about 5 minutes, and we chose to ride up but walk back down, so it was only 2 euros each. 

Seeing Bom Jesus was definitely worthwhile! The basilica is majestic, and although we could only peek inside because of a service in progress, walking around the grounds afforded spectacular views. Not only could we see the city, but also, walking back down allowed us to see the many chapels and sculptures. Looking back up from the bottom really gives you a sense of the scale and symmetry. Highly recommend!
reviews/1/text: Bom Jesus is awesome and the Funicular makes the place really accessible.  You can take a bus to the base and then for €3 buy a round trip ticket.  Everything on top is free so it makes for a very nice inexpensive excursion
reviews/2/text:
Yes! Of course that we have done the Bom Jesus Funicilar too.
It was raining in that time but was also good
reviews/3/text: we stayed in porto so took the train about 1 hour then taxi from station to bom jesus cost 10 euros including tip  so we started at the top ad wow what an amazing place to visit its not just about the views it has other places to visit while there then did the walk down which was steady and easy would not like to do it in bad weather looks like an accident waiting to happen find a day and enjoy the whole braga experience well worth it
reviews/4/text:
I took Bus 2 - Bom Jesus- from the bus station.  I thought it was walking distance from the city center, but I'm glad I took the bus.  I hiked from the bottom to the top of the Monument.  I took my time and had to catch my breath because I have not checked in at my albergue at the city center.  Around 4pm, the first half of the hike up the stairs is shaded so it nice and comfortable.  

Aside from the church, they also have a gift shop, cafe, ice cream shop, and keep on walking to the top (not much) to find a restaurant and a small lake where you can rent a small boat or have a picnic.   I wish I had more time, but  I only had 2 hours.

I was able to take Bus 2 from the same spot I got off which was across the funicular queue.
reviews/5/text: Easily accessible by bus (N°2 from Liberdade, 1.55e, ticket can be bought in the bus), worth the visit.
reviews/6/text: its worth the effort. At the train station ...wait for Bus 2. It's named 'Bom Jesus' ...the cost for one way is 1.55 Euros ...the bus runs every 13 minutes and drops you off at Bom Jesus. Don;t take the Funicular ....take the steps. It's an easy climb.
reviews/7/text: This was fun.  We missed out on the funicular opportunities elsewhere in our trip to Portugal.  Fortunately, our guide told us that this is the oldest operating funicular in the Iberian peninsula.  It began operation in 1882.  Another notable historical footnote is that it runs on water power.  We were shown how the water works and moves the tram.  Ingenious!
reviews/7/title: Must take funicular up and the steps down
reviews/8/text: Photo tip: if you drive up the hill as if you are going to the entrance of Bom Jesus, pass the parking lot where you would park to take the funicular (the road will become one lane each way at this point) - keep driving a short way and there is a pull off at the bottom of the stairs to Bom Jesus. If you do not want to walk down the stairs and back up, this is the best photo opportunity.
reviews/9/text: Absolutely amazing views.  Well worth the exercise that is achieved by walking the grounds and the flights of steps.  If you are in Braga this is a must see.
reviews/10/text:
This entire complex is amazing.  Absolutely beautifully landscaped and maintained.  Views from the common area at the top of the steps are spectacular.

If you are a photographer, you will love this, but plan around the sun's position as it makes a huge difference.

The church is equally beautiful.  This is a place you could spend the entire day as there are caves and garden to explore in addition to what most of the pictures show.

I was on a tour, so my time was limited.   I plan to return and spend the night at the hotel on the property.
reviews/10/title: Not enough time to enjoy this place fully
reviews/11/text: This location, historically viewed as a sacred mountain, has been a place of pilgrimage since at least the 14th century. And the sanctuary has been a work in progress for over 600 years! It was gloomy and raining as our tour guide drove us to the entrance at the top. My spirits were lifted as soon as I walked into the church! Small chapels representing the stations of the cross line the sides, but it was the Crucifixion scene behind the main altar that made me gasp. Afterwards, we walked down the fabulous Baroque stairway amid fountains, statues, chapels, and gardens. I can’t imagine climbing up 600 steps on your knees as some pilgrims do! Honestly, in the rain, it was not the view or experience I was hoping for. Yet still so stunning and I was grateful to be there. UNESCO inscribed Bom Jesus as a World Heritage Site in 2019 (why it took that long I don’t know). Do not miss. Even in the rain. Just take care you don’t slip on the wet stones.
reviews/12/text: A beautiful, amazing, exceptional place. Te stairs were built in very unique way, they look impressive while standing at their bottom. There is a great view of Braga from te top. Although it is a busy place, it is quiet, a good place to stop and just to be there.
reviews/13/text: Beautiful place. Full of history, clean and quiet enough to spend some time relaxing. The church and everything that surrounds it is very well cared for and especially the stairs that are very beautiful and with a perfect design
reviews/14/text: A delightful location. We arrived at the back of the park by taxi and walked in through parkland and down through the site. An excellent experience. avoid summer Saturdays if you want access to the church as the day we were visited there was a steady stream of weddings. Easy to get bus back into town from the bottom of the steps.
reviews/15/text: Your legs will tire walking these stairs. The stairs themselves could do with complete renovation. They are gritty.
reviews/16/text: We give a star to views. Another star to the historicity. What we did not like is the cleanliness of the stairs. Cleaning and painting could improve a lot
reviews/17/text: At the very top of "Monte de Espinho", in the District of Tenões, at only 5 kms from the center of Braga, you will find the iconic "Santuário do Bom Jesus do Monte". Also known as "Santuário do Bom Jesus de Braga", it is a symbol of the Christian faith and of the importance of the Roman Catholic Church in Portugal. Around the 14th century, a primitive ermitage was erected at the top of "Monte de Espinho" and it soon became a center of Christian pilgrimage. Years later, in 1784, Archbishop Dom Gaspar de Bragança commissioned Portuguese architect Carlos Luís Ferreira da Cruz Amarante the construction of the actual Sanctuary. It was finally inaugurated in 1811 and is one of the first Neoclassical constructions in Portugal, but Baroque and Rococo characteristics can also be seen. A monumental staircase and a beautiful elevator connect the lower part of "Monte de Espinho" to the Sanctuary itself, at its top. The staircase - with all its chapels, statues, fountains and points of observation - symbolizes the sacred route to the "Way of the Cross" and a rite of penitential purification. Unmissable to all those visiting Braga and, remember, Unesco has appointed the "Santuário do Bom Jesus do Monte", in 2019, a "World Heritage Site"! Enjoy!
reviews/17/title: A symbol of the Christian faith in Northern Portugal!
reviews/18/text: On your way up to the magnificent "Santuário do Bom Jesus do Monte" (at the top of "Monte de Espinho", in Tenões - a district of Braga), it is a must to stop at its observation point - "Miradouro do Santuário do Bom Jesus do Monte", located at 116 mts, on the mid-way to the top. A wide esplanade, a gazebo and unforgettable views of the Sanctuary above, of the Baroque monumental stairway, and of the many chapels belonging to the sacred "Way to the Cross" route. And if you don't know yet, the "Santuário do Bom Jesus do Monte" was appointed by Unesco, in 2019, a "World Heritage Site"! Unmissable! Enjoy!
reviews/18/title: Unforgettable views of Bom Jesus do Monte and surroundings!
reviews/19/text: In Tenões, a district of Braga, at the top of "Monte de Espinho", stands the awesome "Santuário do Bom Jesus do Monte" (a Unesco appointed, in 2019, "World Heritage Site"!). There are three routes to reach the Sanctuary - by the road, by climbing the monumental Baroque stairway, or finally by the romantic "Elevador do Bom Jesus do Monte". As a matter of fact, this is the most popular (and almost inexpensive) way to reach the Sanctuary. The elevator, dating from the 19th century, connects the lower part of "Monte de Espinho" to the "Santuário do Bom Jesus do Monte", at 267 mts above. This "funicular" is the first one built in the Iberian Peninsula and is the oldest in the world, still in service, using the water balance system! Just amazing! Enjoy!
reviews/19/title: A romantic funicular to reach the famous Sanctuary!

name: Museu dos Biscainhos
ranking: #11 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #11 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text:
The building was erected in the 17th century and modified over the centuries.
In the 19th century it was owned by the second counts of Bertiandos and their daughter, D. Maria da Conceição Eugénia, she was married to D. João Lobo Machado Cardoso do Amaral and Meneses, 2nd Viscount of Paço de Nespereira, former civil governor of Braga.
The builkding got classified as a Property of Public Interest since the year 1949.
There is a cost to visit, the visit is part guided (interior part) and a part free “Garden”, it's worth a visit, and you can take pictures everywhere.
reviews/1/text: Whilst we did not spend time in the museum, the gardens are very attractive and probably the best preserved garden in Braga.
reviews/2/text: This takes little time and is worth the side trip. Beautiful grounds and palace make it easy to imagine what life was like for wealthy merchants a couple of hundred years ago.
reviews/2/title: Excellent, inexpensive, 5 minute walk from the cathedral
reviews/3/text:
I visited the museum on the second day of my stay in the city. The price was good (only a couple euros) and it was definitely worth it. The gardens were beautiful and quite relaxing. The house itself can only be visited as part of a “tour”, as in you’ll be in a group with a guide, who’ll open each room after everybody will be done with the one being currently visited. The house boasts an astonishing collection of paintings and period furniture. 

I would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting the city!!
reviews/4/text: To pay 4 euros and see such a house with valuable objects and also access a quaint garden is totally surprising! We probably liked most the kitchen.
reviews/5/text: If you take your time looking through the garden areas that you can explore on your own and really take in the beautiful tiles and architecture of the house, you will enjoy your experience.  Gorgeous tiling all over!
reviews/6/text: Museu dos Biscainhos is a good museum, in a way.... depending how you view your experience. The tours offered are the only way to enter and inspect the museum. They are, however, quite restrictive timewise and that means you do not always get enough time to view and absorb whatever is exhibited. The guides are there more to guard, rather than guide, as well as to push visitors along and finish the so called tour on time. There are information cards in English which visitors are meant to use, but unless you are a speed reading champion you will not be able to get all the information or to actually view the objects and other things displayed. The Garden is also great and you are not rushed like in the museum.
reviews/7/text: The visit begins with a view of the gardens and then you can walk through the palace but with a guide. Panels in English are in each room. The rooms are furnished so they give you a good idea of how the rich lived in the 1700’s. Interesting about the role of aristocratic women. Still influenced by the muslims women stayed in the home and sat on carpets on the floor. The stables and kitchen are also interesting. Very close to the cathedral.
reviews/8/text: This Palace and museum are very good if you're trying to see other things apart from churches in Braga.
reviews/9/text: Interesting summary of the lifestyle of the rush in Braga. Nice explanations at each door which allows better understanding of the contents.
reviews/10/text: Viewing of this museum us by guided tour. I managed to get there just after a tour started so was able to catch up with the group, which was just a couple. The guide did not speak much English (I think the couple were Portuguese) but she was able to give me a basic explanation for each room. There are also explanation cards in each room in English. The rooms are very well presented. You can also visit the gardens which are very nice.
reviews/11/text: Arrange for a guided tour of the house.  It is huge and is full of beautiful antiques.  The design of the rooms and its entirety is lovely, great representation of the good life of the rich.  Just beautiful.
reviews/12/text: The museum can only be visited at set times with a 'guide'.  We walked around the garden, which needed a bit more loving care, before the 'guide' let us into the house.  However, the 'guide' was merely there to usher people from room to room and not to impart information.  I understand that the 'guide' system had to be set up because when unaccompanied people took things from the rooms!!!  There were description cards in each room but we were rushed into the next room before I had time to read it.  A shame as there were some interesting things to see.  This was probably the most disappointing venue that I visited during my three days in Braga and Guimaraes.
reviews/12/title: Quite interesting but not given sufficient time to look
reviews/13/text: You feel like you are part of the nobility of the eighteenth century when you step foot on this property, and are transported to a place that features slaves, servants, and chaplains. One of the most prestigious places in Braga, this is a location that every traveler should take advantage of viewing.
reviews/13/title: the large aristocratic rooms and baroque style gardens
reviews/14/text: Quite hidden this museum is actually a very place to visit, it´s a place with a lot of history and that allows the visitor to see life in another era, plus the gardens are very nice.
reviews/15/text: OK, the guides all say it opens at 9:30, so we had to walk around town for another 35 minutes, which we spent literally walking around town (for 1 hour), but by 10:45 we were allowed to already explore the beautiful garden (a park it is). At 11 we got a nice lady to accompany the 2 of us, on our tour of the house, of which some rooms are quite stunning. Her explanation, together with the informative leaflets in most rooms, gives you an idea of the wealth of the family that once used this as a second home. The kitchen is visited last, and is by no means the least. If in Braga, this is a must on your visiting list
reviews/15/title: private tour of a beautiful place
reviews/16/text: The tour was interesting with some very nice rooms. The tour is self paced and you are just reading the materials. I felt that the tour guide was rushing a little because you are only supposed to be in the building for 25 minutes for the tour. I was reading the English material so it was taking me some time to do that and also look at all the rooms. Still a very nice time! After you can spend as long as you like in the gardens which were beautiful!! Definitely worth the 2 euros.
reviews/17/text: The house is only visited on guided tours but that was good, and in several languages. The garden is equally beautiful
reviews/18/text: Just reviewing the palace itself(the garden not included in this) and it is interesting and you can get a good hour in there. Very interesting architecture with a good guide which explains well and answers your questions.
reviews/19/text: This is s small museu with a beautiful garden, all in barroco style. The access to the garden it´s free.
reviews/19/title: This a Museu and a Garden in barroco style.

name: Igreja da Misericordia de Braga
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Braga And Guimaraes Private Tour From Porto
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Barcelos, Braga and Guimaraes private tour from Porto
ranking: #13 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #13 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text:
The Misericórdia Church is located next to the “Sé”, in the historic center of the city. It is one of the only Renaissance monuments in the city, and is included in the set of buildings in the Sé Cathedral of Braga.
It belongs to the Santa Casa da Misericórdia of Braga.
The church was built between the years 1560 and 1562, at the time of Archbishop D. Frei Bartolomeu dos Mártires (1559-1558).
Over the centuries, it underwent several renovations, acquiring its current appearance in the year 1891.
It has been classified as a Property of Public Interest since the year 1977.
reviews/1/text: wide avenue in the center of the city. You can see all the historic and well preserved buidilngs and it gets to the Liberdade Square.
reviews/2/text: Loved the outside and the inside of the church. This church was one of the stops on the guided tour we took. Was not disappointed.
reviews/3/text: We were just wandering Braga and came across this church.  I think we entered from the back and started with a small set of ruins that are kept outside.  They were interesting, in addition to the pretty church.  Don't forget to wander out there.
reviews/3/title: Pretty Little Church - Don't Miss the Ruins in the Back
reviews/4/text: If you do the very interesting Braga baroque itinerary, try to enter this church located close to the cathedral. The main altar is a jewel of the Portuguese baroque style. Enjoy!
reviews/5/text: Igreja da Misericordia de Braga is a rather lovely church. It's richly decorated and there are some really terrific carvings. There is a bit of glitter as well! The church was built in the second half of the 16th century and there have been a few minor renovations since that time! Worth visiting.
reviews/6/text: We had looked to light a candle in a number of churches in Porto and Braga but could not find one. It was great to find that we were in fact asked to do so here. The church is beautiful but you should also visit the courtyard to see the artefacts there. This is worth doing. This was the last church we visited visit during our stay in Portugal and did not perhaps appreciate its full beauty.
reviews/7/text: A very beautiful church, rich and full of art. Located in the center of the city so it's very easy to see.
reviews/8/text:
We visited Igreja da Misercordia de Braga in historic old town and were amazed at the extent to which artifacts have been preserved and displayed within its walls.

No fee was charged but we were allowed to explore, the only thing asked was to light a candle for the saint of your choice, all of which had a figure and candle display in the central corridore. The candles are all electronic ones now so it is just symbolic.
Visible security is present thru all areas of the church.

Inner courtyards had displays of remnants of gravestones and historic carvings,  there was an inner glass covered central flower garden which was very pretty and let in light.

The area where services are performed was very ornate, and you were also able to view from high the buriel vault and caskets of those who headed the church in a seperate chamber.

It was an unexpected hidden jewel, an experience we wont forget.
reviews/8/title: A must see for the church itself and the historic displays
reviews/9/text:
Must see if you are in Braga !
It looks like nothing from the outside but wow, inside your jaw drops
reviews/10/text:
This is one of the best church interiors i have seen. The ornamentation in beautiful carvings of glitters. It is a medieval architecture yet the altarpiece is no doubt a baroque.

There are a lot of surprises in Braga. We were awed by the beautiful architecture and artistry herein.
reviews/11/text: Another amazing church full of artwork and sculptures that shows the clear passion they had for re-establishing Christianity following the fall of the Roman empires influence in the region by the Moors and the Muslim way of life.
reviews/12/text: This small beautiful church located in the heart of the city surely worth a visit if you are passing by.
reviews/12/title: Nice beautiful little church in the heart of the city
reviews/13/text:
Renaissance church (1562) with facades in mannerist style, is one of the oldest of Braga.
Inside the magnificent baroque altarpiece is a must. For sacred art lovers a church not to be missed.
reviews/13/title: Old church with a magnificent baroque altarpiece!
reviews/14/text: Was attracted to the church first by the mesmerizing sculpture of many hands which appear to be made of bronze, then by the roman- like relics in the courtyard leading up to the entry to the church. The atmosphere is hushed and there are locals who come there to worship. Do not attempt to take photos of the shrine, especially if there are worshippers in attendance. Officials spring out of the shadows with clicking tongues and wagging fingers! The Church Shop is an interesting place to visit. There are art exhibitions pieces for purchase from the to time, mostly sculptures. Diaries and embroidery ware are abundant, but prices are steep.
reviews/15/text: In het grote kerkelijke compleks van Braga, de Sé, is deze kerk een bijzondere. Allereerst liggen de overblijfselen van de aartsbisschoppen op volgorde van overlijden in een crypte erachter. Daarbij is een kleine kapel. In de kerk bevinden zich meerdere kleine altaar nissen, met relikwiën, beelden en voorwerpen die duidelijk maken over wie het gaat. Wanneer je de combinatie maakt met een bezoek aan de Sé, zelfde entree, ingesloten in de prijs, neig je deze kerk te vergeten, maar dat is dit niet  waard. Wij komen er regelmatig met gasten en vrienden.
reviews/16/text: Naast de Se valt deze kerk een beetje weg. Dat is jammer, want het kan zich prima staande houden. De ingang is niet via de straat, maar via de binnenplaats waar de toegangskaarten voor de kathedraal worden verkocht. Een oase van rust.
reviews/17/text: Uma igreja Lindissima ,como outras situadas em Braga.Mas esta é  lugar muito especial! A não perder, vale a pena a visita.❤❤
reviews/18/text: Esta belíssima igreja localiza-se no centro histórico de Braga e é um dos únicos monumentos renascentistas da cidade. O altar tem uma talha dourada magnífica. Merece ser visitada.
reviews/19/text: 旧市街のメインストリート沿いにある教会で、大聖堂の敷地内にあります。中に入るとシンプルですが、バロック様式の祭壇があり、ステンドグラスもありました。また棺が並んでいる部屋もありました。
reviews/19/title: 大聖堂の隣にあります

name: Torre de Menagem
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Braga and Guimarães Full Day Private Tour from Porto

offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Barcelos, Braga and Guimarães Tour from Esposende

photo/caption: A vista da torre próxima a Catedral.
ranking: #25 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #25 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text:
What you get to see when you are looking after the “Castle of Braga” are the remains of the castle it is the product of the 13th century construction campaign, a century of intense military construction activity and which corresponds to most of our medieval defensive structures, both castles and urban fences.

The “Tower” or “Torre de Menagem” is the most important remaining element of the ancient castle built by D. Dinis. With about 30 meters high (and a three-storey interior), it still stands out in the urban fabric of the city, despite its extreme proximity to many later buildings. Its construction reveals a Gothic design.
reviews/1/text: Nice tower in the center of the city. It seems well preserved on the outside. It was closed when I visited.
reviews/2/text:
I had high expectations before visiting this tour. From the outside, it looks stunning, although... once you get in, things fall apart. There are some original parts of the tour still standing, but most of it, it's modern arrangements. I believe it's only free to go on Mondays or Tuesdays - you have to check. 

I kept climbing it with hopes to see the city from above like you do in Porto in the Clerigos Tower, but nope, it's closed!

The strongest point is the old maps of the city!
reviews/3/text: Torre de Menagem is a Middle Ages Tower located in the center of the old town of Braga, a city in the North of Portugal, near Porto. It is the only remain of the old castle of Braga and it is possible to go up to see nice views of the surroundings. Pitifully, it is not so high, so you can only some nearer streets. Beautiful.
reviews/4/text: Torre de Menagem is the only thing that remains of the old castle that used to be in this general area. The castle was built in the 2nd century, but over time things have changed somewhat, and today only the Keep (Torre de Menagem) of the original castle remains! This is now a sort of museum which doesn't really cost anything to visit, and which contains information detailing the local history. Unfortunately the information is in Portuguese only, but the exhibits provide sufficient evidence to work out some of the history behind them. The views over the city are supposed to be great from the top floor of the Tower which has four levels. We were unable to get to the top.
reviews/5/text: Closed in at the top you don’t get great views from this tower. There is an exhibit on each floor about the history of the region but all the information is in Portuguese, no English. Still it is free so you can’t complain.
reviews/6/text: Don't think you'll have a great view over Braga, you can see lots of places but being high it's not the best characteristic of this. The surroundings are not very beautiful, also. The schedule it's kind of reduced also. But it's a very well preserved building and they have a very good exposition on the inside, if would want to know more about Braga! And it's free
reviews/7/text: During our Braga visit we checked also this attraction. After climb to the last floor we have seen a part of the city including nearby Praca de Republica. Its worth visiting.
reviews/8/text:
The Keep in Braga is the only building left of the Braga castle. The Keep is now a museum providing a brief historical overview of the development of Braga since the Romans. On each floor narratives are all in Portuguese, but you can obtain a abbreviated version in English at the entrance. Although there is no access to the outside you have some good views of Brage from the windows on the top floor. Entry is free of charge 
If you are in Braga worth a visit as part of the Braga medieval tour.
.
reviews/9/text: We visited the tower and could only enter the second highest floor. The top (outside) floor was closed. There was not very much to see from the second highest floor.
reviews/10/text:
A very well thought out (albeit brief) history of the city, a must see for visitors and locals! 
Very visual, adequate for all ages!
reviews/11/text: I and my wife went there and enjoy the view. Unfortunately, the temporary exhibition was off, so we lack something else apart the view.
reviews/11/title: A high view to the city
reviews/12/text: In het centrum, enigszins verscholen staat dit restant van de verdedigingswerken van Braga. Die zijn al jaren niet meer nodig, want het is een veilig land en zeker deze gemeente. De toren is groot en je kunt er om heen lopen. Waar in andere steden de torens een nieuwe functie kregen is dat hier niet het geval.
reviews/12/title: Waar komt die nu opeens vandaan.
reviews/13/text: A Torre de Menagem localiza-se na Rua Do Castelo e  está escondida por outras construções. Esta torre é o que sobrou de um castelo que existiu ali.
reviews/14/text:
Bonita torre de Menagem,bem no centro de Braga, do pouco que resta do Castelo.
Pena é estar tão fechada entre edificios que passa completamente despercebida.
É pena.
reviews/15/text:
Det är känt att romarna redan på 200-talet började bygga en stadsmur runt ”Bracara Augusta”. Det är däremot lite känt om den fortsatta utvecklingen, men man tror sig veta att muren utvidgades i mitten på 1100-talet runt ett centralt torn. På 1300-talet beordrade kung Denis att ett palats skulle byggas, arbetet gick dock långsamt och med långa avbrott. I mitten av 1800-talet började man att riva murarna, ett arbete som pågick fram till 1905 då bara centraltornet fanns kvar. Det räddades för eftervärlden och är idag den enda hela byggnad som finns kvar av Bragas slott. Delar av det gamla slottet finns dock kvar och har återanvänts i de omgivande byggnaderna, klocktornet i kyrkan Lapa är t.ex. ett torn från slottet och en del av den östra muren finns kvar inne i kvarteret.
Tornet har renoverats under 1900-talet och kan besökas, utsikten från toppen sägs vara utmärkt. När vi var i Braga var tornet öppet på eftermiddagarna, men vi tittade bara på utsidan. Väl värt ett besök, tornet ligger diskret till men ändå bara 50 m från gågatan Rua do Souto.
reviews/16/text: Si trova dietro la piazza principale, molto nascosta dagli altri edifici. Quando siamo andati a Braga non era visitabile.
reviews/17/text:
Del castillo de Braga apenas subsisten la torre del homenaje y otra de su muralla, reutilizada como campanario de la iglesia da Lapa. Construido en la parte más alta de la ciudad, aprovechando su muralla y junto a la puerta do Souto, este castillo fue mandado construir por D. Denís a principios del siglo XIV. Reformado en varias ocasiones, a mediados del XIX comienza su demolición junto con la de las murallas de la ciudad: en 1858 se derriba la puerta do Souto y la muralla adyacente.
La torre del homenaje tiene unos 30 m. de altura y cuatro pisos. Como era corriente, se accede a ella por el primero; sobre la puerta de entrada figuran las armas reales de don Denís.
Declarado Monumento Nacional en 1910, la torre fue entonces restaurada. Propiedad del ayuntamiento, hoy alberga un interesante museo sobre la historia de la ciudad.
reviews/18/text: D’une hauteur de 30 m, ce donjon faisait partie du système de défense mis en place au début du XIVe siècle sous le règne du roi Denis du Portugal (1261-1325). Achevé en 1373 sous le règne du roi Fernando, la muraille entourant le château de Braga (Antigo Castelo de Braga) était à l’origine composée de cinq tours de vigie en granit. Une grande partie de cette fortification incluant le château a été démolie au début du XXe siècle, après avoir été utilisée comme prison. De nos jours, la Torre de Menagem est utilisée comme galerie d’art.
reviews/18/title: Donne un cachet médiéval au centre historique de Braga
reviews/19/text: Excelente passeio para conhecer as origens dessa terra maravilhosa!!! Atualmente, tem-se uma vista panorâmica da cidade. Vale o passeio!!
subcategory_ranking: #25 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Rua de Sao Domingos, 4, Braga Portugal
name: Igreja de Sao Victor
ranking: #24 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #24 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: Igreja de Sao Victor was a real surprise. We like visiting places such as this as they are usually quite lovely and pleasing to the eye. This church does not really look remarkable from the outside, but once inside you will change your opinion in no time. Those blue tiles all over the walls are fantastic! There is heavy decoration and ornamentation, particularly around the altar. This is a must see if you are visiting the city.
reviews/1/text: Don't expect to see something big, yet it's size is exactly what it is supposed to see in a middle sized city in Portugal. Very pretty
reviews/2/text: It is really one of the best churches in Braga. Not so popular as another but very beautiful. Must see.
reviews/2/title: One of the best churches in Barga
reviews/3/text: There are so many churches in Braga that it is hard to visit them all but this one stood out with all the tiles fully covering the full height of the walls each side. The alter gave me the impression of a stairway to heaven which I thought was an excellent way to get the religious message across to the congregations. Well worth seeing.
reviews/4/text: This is a beautiful church! This is one of not to miss in Braga. Amazing blue tiles it is really worth a visit!
reviews/5/text: This is a beautiful church! It is really portuguese style inside with blue tiles and even though it isn't fantastic from outside it is really worth a visit!
reviews/6/text: Braga is a nice city to walk by and visit ancient buildings. This church deserved being visited due to its beautiful tiles in the inside, and majestic facade on the outside. If you have the chance to visit in a praying day, you could enjoy a beautiful ritual.
reviews/7/text:
É uma igreja do final do séc. XVII e como acontece com muitas igrejas, foi construída no lugar onde anteriormente existiu um templo mais antigo.
O interior é de uma grande beleza, destacando-se os azulejos azuis e brancos revestindo toda a área das paredes laterais, onde também existem algumas imagens de santos.
O altar é todo e talha dourada.
Tem coro alto e um bonito órgão de tubos, construído em 1815 e que parece funcionar.
A pia batismal é das mais bonitas que vi.
É difícil encontrar esta igreja aberta fora do horário das missas. Visitei-a no fim de um funeral.
Está classificada como "Imóvel de Interesse Público", desde setembro/1977.
Tem informação no exterior sobre a sua história.
reviews/8/text: Esta igreja ficava perto do nosso alojamento e até tivemos direito a assistir a um casamento.....muito bonita e bem cuidada
reviews/9/text: Uma belíssima Igreja do século XVII que tem sua principal razão do encanto a simplicidade. Construída sob a ordem do arcebispo D. João de Sousa, que tinha hábitos mais elevados, especialmente por ter sido embaixador em Roma. Razao pela qual quis mostrar para a cidade de Braga toda a sua importância, e o seu cargo como Senhor de Braga, a cidade dos Acerbispos.
reviews/10/text: Uma igreja com muitos painéis bonitos de azulejos. Quando a visitei estava a decorrer uma missa, pelo que não sei a altura em que está aberto, mas se tiver possibilidade de visitar, não hesite.
reviews/11/text: Deze kerk is van binnen en van buiten bekleed met Azulejos. Buitenkant is geel, en de binnenkant bevat talloze taferelen die uitgebeeld zijn in blauwe azulejos. Een must om te zien.
reviews/12/text: アヴェニダ・セントラル公園付近を散策していました。聖ビクター教会に来ました。ファサードの上は、切妻屋根の妻壁にできる三角形で造られています。聖堂の天井は船底天井になっており、これが逆なら完全に水に浮くかのごとくです。また側廊のアズレージョは、目映がよい青の世界に広がっています。
reviews/12/title: ペディメントのバランスが素晴らしい
reviews/13/text: Mais uma linda Igreja oferecida pela cidade dos arcebispos ao viajante,merece ser admirada,com detalhes interessantes.Recomendo.
reviews/14/text: Bonita por dentro e muito importante , Fica na Rua D. Pedro V e continuando a caminhada vai chegar na Pça da Republica.Visitamos na hora de um casamento. Pela Rua  São Domingos, tem melhor acesso para quem tem dificuldade para andar, pois na frente tem degraus e a Rua é estreita para parar.
reviews/15/text:
Kirken i barok stil fra 1686 blev opført af en de Sousa, hvis våbenskjold ses i facaden øverst, nedenfor en roset flankeret af to ukendte ærkebisper og som indgang en port med arkitrav over. Det er faktisk en meget smuk og enkel facade.
Indvendigt følger arkitekturen den portugisiske skik med romanske buer og balkoner, der dog i koret er et loft med tøndehvælving og en virkelig smuk flisebeklædning.
Alteret er den sædvanlige pompøse barokstil med søjler og gulddekorationer.
Der er så mange kirker i Braga, at man kan få tiden til at gå med dem alene, men Victor-kirken er en af dem, som jeg gerne vil anbefale at besøge.
reviews/16/text: L’extérieur austère tranche avec l’intérieur richement décoré d’ajulesos et dorures diverses, la façade en forme de temple avec chapiteau corinthiens fait preuve d’originalité.
reviews/17/text: Braga é cheia de igrejas; e chega uma hora que já nada parece ser novidade. Mas esta igreja, apesar de ser mais do mesmo, é sóbria e bela. Se estiver por perto, vale a visita.
reviews/18/text: Participamos do Festival de órgão de Braga e uma das apresentações foi nessa Igreja. Simples, mas muito imponente, acústica perfeita.
reviews/19/text: Es una iglesia de una sola nave con una decoración interior realmente preciosa, sus azulejos, sus pinturas, sus esculturas y altar mayor. Uno más de los magníficos monumentos de Braga.
subcategory_ranking: #24 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Largo Carlos Amarante, Braga 4700-308 Portugal
name: Igreja de Sao Marcos
ranking: #19 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #19 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: This is the place to get a nice Instagram pic in front of the Braga sign. I like how they've changed the colour of the sign to the Ukrainian flag 🇺🇦
reviews/1/text: One of the biggest in the city of Braga. Really nice inside and outside and a "must" if you visit the city.
reviews/2/text: This building includes a great hotel and a beautiful church. Very central and worth a visit. Braga has beautiful sites and churches everywhere.
reviews/3/text:
Beautiful 18th century baroque church on the lovely Placa Carlos Amarante. It's on the opposite end of the square to the magnificent Igreja de Santa Cruz which is also worth seeing.
San Marcos is just beautiful too and is the picture postcard view of Braga that most tourists will seek with the white Braga sign in front on the square.
reviews/4/text: Although it is not the most famous church in Braga, it is a best place to take photo because of its beautiful outside and the Symbol of BRAGA in front of it.
reviews/5/text: It is a baroque church owned by Santa Casa da Misericórdi, which is a square with another church. Next to the Church recently opened a Vila Galé Collection Braga hotel in place of the old hospital..
reviews/5/title: The square of the Church of Mercy
reviews/6/text: This church is located on the same square of Santa Cruz church where you’ll probably go by visiting Braga. Although not worth a detour you can profit by being in there to enter it and to admire the transition from the baroque to the neoclassic style. Enjoy!
reviews/6/title: Worth to enter but not worth a detour
reviews/7/text: This is a nice enough 18th century church, but it's not one that you need to go out of your way to visit. That said, however, old Braga is a small city, and you are likely to come across this place in your trip, as we did. The outside is much better than the interior. The church is very close to another interesting site, the Palacio do Raio, which is only a few minutes walk further up the road, "around the corner".
reviews/8/text: This beautiful building is just around the corner from the Palacio do Raio. There is a large park in front with large letters BRAGA to make interesting photos. Although pretty on the inside it is the outside that is the most impressive
reviews/8/title: Also called  igreja do hospital de S Marcos
reviews/9/text: This beautiful harmonious building is overlooked by most, I suspect. It's probably because they don't even know its name. Igreja de São Marcos, dating back to the 18th century, was the work of Carlos Amarante, who was also involved in buildings such as Bom Jesus do Monte and Populo Church. In fact, you can see some similarities between São Marcos and the church of Bom Jesus. Walk around the square and admire Amarante's work from afar and close-up.
reviews/9/user/user_location/name: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
reviews/10/text: The building is much more impressive than the small church so don't expect anything huge. So even if you look just from the outside you'll clearly have the most impressive picture. It was was the first hospital in Braga and the employers of the hotel are very good and reliable.
reviews/11/text:
Very good, 
Not Baroc style. 
In the middle of the city near others churchs.
A large garden in front of it.
reviews/12/text: If you are visiting the city, its another place to pass by, its really near the center. On the way to Palácio do Raio.
reviews/12/title: It was closed, anyway is still nice from the outside
reviews/13/text:
É a igreja que se destaca nesta que é uma das principais praças da cidade e onde estão implantadas as letras "BRAGA", que os turistas muito gostam de fotografar, com esta igreja como "pano de fundo".
A Igreja do Hospital de São Marcos começou a ser construída na segunda metade do séc. XVIII e só foi inaugurada em 1836, como está escrito numa placa no exterior. 
O interior não é grande, fez-me lembrar a Basílica do Sameiro. Destaco o teto por cima da zona do altar.
Tem coro alto e um bonito órgão de tubos que não pude fotografar.
Tem uma rampa de acesso no exterior para pessoas em cadeira de rodas ou com dificuldade em subir/descer degraus.
Costuma estar quase sempre fechada, mas consegui visitar o interior numa sexta-feira a meio da tarde.
A entrada é gratuita.
reviews/14/text: Στην κάτω πλευρά της φωτογενούς Largo Carlos Amarante, συναντάμε την όμορφη εκκλησία του Αγίου Μάρκου. Κατασκευάστηκε το 18ο αιώνα, με αρχιτέκτονα τον Carlos Amarante, εξαιτίας του οποίου πήρε το όνομά της και η πλατεία. Αρχικά, η εκκλησία αποτελούσε τμήμα του νοσοκομείου του Αγίου Μάρκου, που σήμερα όμως δε λειτουργεί πλέον. Αντίθετα, στο τμήμα του πρώην κτηρίου του νοσοκομείου, δεξιά από την Igreja de Sao Marcos, λειτουργεί από το 1916 το ξενοδοχείο "Vila Galé". Η ίδια η εκκλησία έχει έναν έντονο μπαρόκ χαρακτήρα και στην πρόσοψή της ξεχωρίζουν το διπλό καμπαναριό, τα μεγάλα παράθυρα και μια σειρά από αγάλματα αγίων. Μεταξύ των αγαλμάτων, κεντρική θέση καταλαμβάνει αυτό του Αγίου Μάρκου. Σύμφωνα με τους περισσότερους ερευνητές, είναι τα αυθεντικά λείψανα του Αποστόλου Μάρκου, αυτά που φυλάσσονται σε πανέμορφα διακοσμημένη θήκη στο εσωτερικό της εκκλησίας.
reviews/15/text: Esta igreja data do século XVI e localiza-se no Largo Carlos Amarante, no centro histórico. Na sua frente há um belo jardim. O seu interior guarda o túmulo do Apóstolo e Bispo São Marcos.
reviews/15/title: Onde está o túmulo de São Marcos!
reviews/16/text:
Då vi bodde på hotellet som ligger till höger om själva ingången till Igreja de Sao Marcos i Braga så var ett besök här självklart. 

Kyrkan är en del av det gamla sjukhuset och en riktigt vacker sådan ska sägas. Målningar i lokalerna är imponerande och taket färgglatt med vackra motiv. Väggarna går nästan i pastellfärger eller åtminstone i ljusblått och vackert och smakfullt. 

Utsmyckningarna är stilfulla och väl värda att beskådas. Altaret är även detta riktigt vackert och du hinner enkelt med att se det hela på en kortare stund så slink gärna in här när du passerar.
reviews/16/title: En riktigt vacker kyrka som ändå inte påminner om en kyrka på utsidan
reviews/17/text: Es el edificio más emblemático e imponente de Largo Amarante y  es el fondo perfecto para la foto con las letras de BRAGA
reviews/18/text: La chiesa non era visitabile ma la facciata è molto bella, soprattutto nel contesto della piazza. Forse ora il complesso è un hotel.
reviews/19/text: ブラガ旧市街にあるサン・マルコス教会で、リベルダーデ通りから一本入ったところにあります。２つの塔があり、教会前は広場になっていてお花が咲いていてきれいでした。病院が併設されています。夜はライトアップされていました。
subcategory_ranking: #19 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Avenida da Liberdade, Braga 4715-387 Portugal
name: Avenida da Liberdade
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Small-Group Braga Tour Including Transfer to Bom Jesus
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Cosmopolitan Braga - Full Day - from Porto
ranking: #18 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #18 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: This is an avenue that feels like a park, there are so many perfectly kept flower beds, beautiful buildings all around, what a relaxing walk!
reviews/1/text:
This is a magnificent grand avenue leading uphill to the central square of Braga. It is resplendent with its flowers and trees with a plethora of shops, cafes and restaurants along it. 
I'd find it hard to believe there is a prettier, more elegant street in Braga. I enjoyed strolling along a good section of it on a sunny spring day
reviews/2/text: It is the main avenue of Braga, in the North South direction, which connects Avenida Central to Monte do Picoto, which is at the end of the avenue.
reviews/3/text: These is the most Famous Avenue in Braga , not so much for the stores and restaurants but because it connects the city Center Square to the parque da Ponte where it is located the São João chapel (São João is the most famous festivity in Braga) . The top part of the avenue is walk only (no cars) with a nice garden , some nice buildings , the famous Theatro Circo and Avenida Liberdade Street Fashion. .
reviews/4/text: Avenida da Liberdade is a lovely avenue. This must be one of, if not the most beautiful road in Braga. It's probably the most important too. It is full of shops, cafes, restaurants, fashion shops, shopping centres..... The road is like a garden, as there are numerous flower beds all along the road. There is a lot of green and there is a lot of colour! It is just amazing! We walked up and down the road for a while and enjoyed it immensely. You can walk, or sit on one of the available spots, and you can even have your drink or lunch if you wish, and watch people go by. Highly recommended.
reviews/5/text: Natuurlijk is deze avenue van de vrijheid een centrum winkelgebied. Onder het wegdek bevindt zich een snelweg, die vanuit de parkeergarage de route uit de stad is. De winkelstad is uitstekend, van Portugese kwaliteit. Meest in het ook springen de bloembedden, die vier keer per jaar in hun geheel opnieuw worden aangeplant. Kleurrijk en geurrijk. Wij wonen in de omgeving, dus komen hier regelmatig. Ook voor een terrasje!
reviews/6/text: É uma avenida grande, pedonal. Passeias um bocado, fazes umas compras na Zara e visitas o Theatro Circo. É bom para passear no Outono ou na Primavera
reviews/7/text: Um passeio de bike nesse lugar é incrível. Corta a cidade e te leva a conhecer todos cantinhos de braga <3.
reviews/8/text: Avenida pedonal,muito movimentada,quer de dia  ou de noite.Muiras lojas de boas marcas.Tem de tudo um pouco.Talvez seja a avenida mais cosmopolitas da cidade,onde se enconta o famoso Teatro Circo.👌👌
reviews/9/text: Η Λεωφόρος Δημοκρατίας (Avenida da Liberdade), αποτελεί μία από τις μεγαλύτερες και κεντρικότερες λεωφόρους της Braga. Έχει κατεύθυνση από Βορρά προς Νότο και η ιστορία της ξεκινάει πριν από το 16ο αιώνα. Στη διάρκεια της μακράς ιστορίας της, άλλαξε πολλές φορές η ονομασία της, για να πάρει το σημερινό όνομά της μόλις το 1974. Ξεχωρίζει ιδιαίτερα το πεζοδρομημένο κομμάτι της μεταξύ της οδού do Raio και της Πλατείας Δημοκρατίας, το οποίο αποτελεί έναν εντυπωσιακό χώρο για βόλτα ψώνια και χαλάρωση, στολισμένο με μεγάλες πρασιές, παγκάκια και υπέροχα φροντισμένα παρτέρια με πολύχρωμα λουλούδια.
reviews/10/text: Vale a pena visitar a avenida da Liberdade e conhecer seu belissimo jardim, tirar lindas fotos, agora na primavera está ainda mais lindo.
reviews/11/text: Al centro di questa avenida, per centinaia di metri, aiuole curatissime  catturano l'attenzione del passante. Un colpo d'occhio fantastico.
reviews/12/text: Lindo passear nessa área de Braga mas bem difícil estacionar o carro pra comer indico ir mais distante
reviews/13/text: Es la típica avenida comercial que te puedes encontrar en cualquier ciudad. No deja de ser bonita pero está comercializada en exceso.
reviews/14/text:
Avenue large avec promenade piétonnier.
Au bas de l'avenue, la fontaine romaine: la vidéo est intéressante, mais il n'y a plus grand chose à voir
reviews/15/text: A Avenida se localiza bem no centro da cidade e possui uma parte exclusiva para pedestres, com uma grande diversidade de comércio e o Theatro Circo e a Praça de República.  Os canteiros são super floridos, extremamente bem cuidados, e possuem alguns bancos ao longo do caminho.
reviews/16/text: Jardim renovado frequentemente o que torna esta avenida sempre atraente E sem trânsito nessa parte com flores onde as crianças podem brincar.Com muitos cafés e lojas de renome.Visitem e passem lá algum tempo.À sua volta têm a zona histórica para descobrirem tudo o que merece ser visto.E é muito diversificado
reviews/17/text: É uma maravilha de praça e avenida no seu começo. Um marco da cidade. Sempre bem cuidada e florida, mesmo no inverno.
reviews/18/text: Preciosa calle decorada cuidadosamente con flores de colores vivos y flanqueadas por bonitos edificios
reviews/19/text: Avenida llena de flores coloridas. Muy amplia para pasear. Nos gustó mucho, es un atractivo para la ciudad y se sacan fotos muy bonitas. También tiene tiendas para comprar de todo y algún sitio para comer. Merece la pena pasear por esta avenida.
subcategory_ranking: #18 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Av de 100 Uniao de freguesias, Braga 4715-165 Portugal
name: Centro comercial Nova Arcada
ranking: #32 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #32 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: Great staff and the decoration is very modern and cozy, making you feel very comfortable. Want to come again soon hopefully
reviews/1/text: We happened to be in the vicinity and had to this shopping centre for a look. Wow! It certainly is modern and it is quite big. There are more than 100 shops of every description and there are shops that you would find in any large shopping mall in a large city.  It compares quite favourably with other similar centres. We had a look and only bought a couple of little things we needed urgently. It looked quite busy on the day.
reviews/2/text: They have a nice space over there's, with many stores and IKEA which is it's main focus. You have lots of places to put your car, so no problem with tons of people at all!
reviews/3/text: É um centro comercial. O que esperas daqui? Tem um continente, um ikea, lojas de roupa e o normal para um centro comercial. Fica um bocado fora da cidade mas vais de carro e vais por isso é igual. Na parte da alimentação a oferta não é muita.
reviews/4/text: Podría ser mejor centro comercial, pero se queda obsoleto no permitiendo la entrada de mascotas, los hay cerca mejores, más cómodos y permiten su entrada...no hay razón para elegirlo frente a otros...
reviews/5/text: Cher pas très bon marché des prix plus que  excessif .Juste bon  pour flâner les jours de pluie et de manger un petit bout .. comment font nos amis Portugais avec leur pouvoir d achat beaucoup plus bas que le nôtre ????
reviews/6/text:
Situado a norte de Braga, o Centro Comercial Nova Arcada tem bons acessos rodoviários, todas as lojas que podemos encontrar num centro comercial desta dimensão e uma loja IKEA.
A decoração interior é moderna e a limpeza irrepreensível.
reviews/7/text: Centro comercial grande. Tiene IKEA y CONTINENTE. Después tiene múltipless tiendas de todo tipo. En la parte de arriba tiene zona de restauración variada. Muy recomendable. Suele haber bastante gente. En el parking es aconsejable ver dónde se aparca, porque puedes perderte fácilmente.
reviews/8/text: Excelente dia com a família. Tarde de compras na IKEA com bons produtos e ótimos preços, jantar no restaurante da IKEA com ótimo atendimento e comida e preços fantásticos. Depois de jantar levei os meus sobrinhos ao Luna Kiss. Eles adoraram. Foi um ótimo tempo na Nova Arcada.
reviews/8/title: Dia de compras na Nova Arcada com duas crianças
reviews/9/text: Burger tres copieux mais beaucoup beaucoup trop salé et surtout pour les enfants.deplus les tarifs sont un peu trop élevés car les burger sont sans les boissons.
reviews/10/text: Centro comercial enorme con gran cantidad de tiendas, una buena zona infantil gratuita y muchos locales de restauración para comer.
reviews/11/text: Muito bom. Espaçoso e moderno. Parking grande. Diversidade de lojas. Bem ventilado. Acessibilidades excelentes na saída Norte de Braga.
reviews/12/text:
Toujours très bon leur hamburger, rien à dire.
La viande est parfaite ainsi que la cuisson.
Le menu est à 11euros, sa vaut le détour.
reviews/13/text: Precioso. Enorme.... Fuimos a ikea y comimos en él. Al ser viernes había  poca gente. Me gustó todo. Es enorme y hay muchas tiendas.
reviews/14/text: Genial cm todos los c.c de portugal. Hay donde comer donde comprar super cuidado todo. Volveré sin duda ninguna
reviews/15/text: CC de fácil acceso y muy completo con gran variedad de tiendas en las que buscar lo que necesites. En principio iba al IKEA pero las demás tiendas me sorprendieron gratamente.
reviews/16/text: Enfin un burger chaud juteux goûteux, à talho burger vous commandez , 10 mm après vous avez votre burger chaud frites maison chaudes pas grasses , en un mot le nec plus ultra du burger allez y vous serez conquis
reviews/17/text:
Me senti muito mal pelo modo como fui tratado pelos funcionarios da Tomatino. Já fazem 2 dias que lá estive e continuo com isto em mente. Honestamente, já vi servirem comida de cachorro melhor do que o Tomatino do Centro comercial Nova Arcada.

Para início o funcionário que deveria cozinhar estava a fazer algo que parecia maravilhoso mas era algo fora do menu e era apenas para ele almoçar. Belos camarões muito bem temperados mas só que para ele e outro funcionário.

Tive que esperar aproximadamente 20 minutos para ser servido 3 pratos para mim e minha família. Comprei e paguei nada barato para ver com imensa tristeza o descaso que tratam o respeito a trabalhar, a comida e o cliente. Utilizaram misturas em pó, daquelas prontas, para fazer um simples molho Alfredo.

Sinceramente me senti muito constrangido e a comida é pessíma. Não recomendo jamais e tampouco voltarei neste local.

Aproveitem IKEA, Toys R Us e outras lojas e mantenham-se o mais longe possível desse péssimo local, o Tomatino.
reviews/17/title: Shopping bom, restauração deixa a desejar.
reviews/18/text: O Centro Comercial Nova Arcada está situado a 3,9 kms de distância do centro de Braga. Suas grandes atrações além das tradicionais lojas de marcas são a Ikea,o Espaço Casa ,o Supermercado Continente e a loja de brinquedos Toysrus. A praça de alimentação é pequena e oferece pouca variedade. O estacionamento no subsolo é grande e gratuito. Vale muito a pena conhecê-lo.
reviews/19/text: Espaço com lojas variadas, muita oferta. Fazer compras aqui é bem mais agradável do que no BragaParque, onde já fomos assaltados três vezes e nada pôde ser feito, porque a maioria das lojas não tem câmaras de vigilância.
subcategory_ranking: #32 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Rua do Miradouro Monte do Picoto, Braga Portugal
name: Miradouro do Monte do Picoto
ranking: #27 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #27 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: You have to be quite a ninja to get here, I mean, you have to take a long walkway up to get here. Most of the locals do some sports in this location.
reviews/1/text:
Whilst visiting Braga, we met with a friend who took us to the Miradouro do Picoto. It is a distance outside the centre, but we were riding motorcycles which made it easy.

The lookout point offers 360º views over the city and towards the surrounding hills. Whilst there, we were able to see the Bom Jesus Sanctuary that we had visited earlier, as well as the Sanctuary of Sameiro that 3km further up the hill. 

Other than the views, there is nothing at the miradour. It is worth a quick visit if you have your own transportation but probably not worth it if you had to walk.
reviews/2/text: From the town centre it is about 30min plus to walk up here, a fair bit of stairs to get up but one gets rewarded with a brilliant view over the whole of Braga and towards the horizon. Try to time the sunset on a clear day.
reviews/3/text: It's completely renewed and it's a very nice place to see the city center. I recommend it if you have a car
reviews/4/text: Good place to take some photos from the city centre, Don´t go alone or couple. Go with a group. Very isolated place, can bring unpleasant surprises. Especially at night.
reviews/4/title: Highest point with view to the citycentre
reviews/5/text: A calm and relaxed place to go alone or with your friends. Nice 360 view trough the city of Braga. Recently some chairs and tables were installed trough that area, suitable for pick-nick or reading a book for example. A very interesting project, related with invasive species, is being developed there. You can go by foot, bicycle or car, but try go on foot, since is near the city center and you can have a nice experience during the small trip to the top of Picoto hill.
reviews/6/text: Het is een prachtig aangelegd pad, met op de top een klein natuurgebied met planten en vooral insecten. Het meest bijzondere is het uitzicht op de kerken van Sameiro en Bon Jésus: een volledig nieuw perspectief. Ook het oude voetbalstadion en de stad zijn de moeite waard van het bekijken. Wij hebben er meer als een uur aan kunnen besteden, zeker wanneer je de wandeling van beneden begint en terug moet, kom je snel aan de 3 uren. Goede parkeergelegenheid boven.
reviews/6/title: Een nieuw perspectief op Sameiro en Bon Jésus.
reviews/7/text: Uma bela vista da cidade de Braga. Acessível para cadeirantes e pessoas com dificuldade de mobilidade. Você tem vistas tão bonitas quanto é outros pontos turísticos.
reviews/8/text:
Numa pequena elevação de terreno, ergue-se este Miradouro do Picoto e daqui temos uma bela panorâmica sobre a cidade de Braga. Para mim é o melhor lugar para se ver a cidade. No ponto mais alto está uma cruz em ferro. 
Tem excelentes acessos e um bom parque de estacionamento ao lado do caminho para o topo.
Achei que fosse um local pouco divulgado e não deve estar aberto à noite, porque tinha um portão de correr na parte mais baixa, na estrada de acesso ao topo.
reviews/9/text: Um ótimo lugar para apreciar uma vista panorâmica de Braga e também um bonito pôr do sol. Possui estacionamento para os carros.
reviews/10/text: Espaço com vista para a cidade. Podem deixar o carro no estacionamento e aceder ao miradouro por uma rampa, sendo este acessível a pessoas com fraca mobilidade.
reviews/10/title: Vista sobre a cidade de Braga
reviews/11/text: Na minha opinião,  a melhor forma de chegar ao Miradouro do Monte Picoto é a caminhar. Pode-se lá chegar a pedalar ou em um automóvel, mas a subida a pé nos permite descortinar aos poucos a vista em 360° da cidade de Braga que vai revelar-se completamente apenas quando chegarmos ao topo, ao pé do Cruzeiro que lá está.
reviews/12/text: Linda vista da cidade de Braga! Um bom passeio (caminhada) em família. Ao chegar ao topo, não tem nada demais a não ser a bela vista da cidade.
reviews/13/text: Desde este mirador se puede observar toda la ciudad de Braga, hay bastantes aparcamientos para quien no quiera ir andando.
reviews/14/text: Vanop dit vrij hoog gelegen uitzichtpunt heb je een schitterend overzicht over de Stad Braga. Een must.
reviews/15/text:
É espectacular a vista sobre a paisagem
Local de interacção com a natureza e riqueza paisagística.
Como alguém já afirmou " a natureza é generosa com aquilo que nos dá"
reviews/15/title: Vista soberba sobre a cidade de Braga e arredores
reviews/16/text: Depois de uma bela subida pelo verde do monte Picoto, a mesma pode ser efectuada a pé ou de bicicleta,( ou de carro) chega-se a um miradouro com uma vista de 360º. em que se pode ver o estádio 1º. de Maio, o Parque da ponte e temos vista até à Sé de Braga, para quem for de carro tem parque de estacionamento.
reviews/17/text:
Boa panorâmica da cidade, conseguindo ter uma visão geral de Braga.
Bom estacionamento e fácil acesso.
Lugar bem cuidado.
reviews/18/text: Faça um picnic, caminhe, corra, aprecie a paisagem ou namore, aqui neste ambiente de ar puro e descontração garantida.
reviews/19/text: Sympa pour le point de vue sur la ville si non pas grand chose à voir de plus mes sympa pour la promenade
subcategory_ranking: #27 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Rua da Praia Fluvial, Braga 4710-000 Portugal
name: Praia Fluvial de Adaufe
ranking: #35 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #35 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: Amazing place for relaxing and having a good time in nature, with the river and to look at other families and friends having a nice time. It's a warm and welcome place full of beauty!
reviews/1/text:
Ontem, domingo de Páscoa, fomos depois de almoço, conhecer este paraíso! 
Ficámos algo incrédulos quando chegámos, com tamanho número de pessoas, música em altos berros de vários locais, ninguém conseguia ouvir a sua própria música tal era a confusão. Montes de gente a jogar a bola.
Antes de entrar verifiquei o que era permitido, daí ter ficado muito surpreendida... também lá estavam imensos cãezinhos, que acho muito bem, não são eles que deixam os locais cheios de lixo.
O sítio é lindo e espero que assim continue 🙏
reviews/2/text: Aan de Cávado rivier, dat is noordelijk van Braga, is in het dorp Adaúfe een groot recreatiegebied gemaakt. Behalve ruime grasvelden kun je het water gemakkelijk in. Het is fris, maar niet koud. Hier zijn speeltuigen te huur voor waterplezier. Er is een restaurant, een vervallen èn een actieve watermolen. Ruim 200 parkeerplekken, want het is er soms op warme dage druk. Erg druk. Aan de overkant van de rivier ligt Barreiros, met haar eigen kleinere praja fluvial de Barreiros.
reviews/3/text: Fantástica praia fluvial, água limpa apesar de um pouco fria. Fácil acesso e parque de estacionamento bastante bom. Possibilidade de fazer churrasco para refeições. Muito espaço verde e fantástica paisagem em redor. Vale a pena!
reviews/4/text:
Bonita praia fluvial, com excelentes condições e acessibilidades, edifícios de apoio, parque de estacionamento, parque de merendas, águas calmas e limpeza geral.
Tem zona balnear vigiada e um circuito de manutenção física.
É um bom local para passar um dia de praia nas águas do Cávado.
reviews/5/text: É uma praia que tem imenso potencial. Acho qque podiam melhorar as instalações públicas, nomeadamente as casas de banho. De resto nada a apontar.
reviews/6/text:
Magnífica paisagem!
Local bem conservado com excelente estacionamento.
Placas com indicação de que não são permitidos animais ):, no entanto havia cães na praia ( o que me parece bem)!
Excelente suporte de serviços: restaurante, boias de alugueres, etc...
Praia vigiada
reviews/7/text:
Praia fluvial com condições para todos desfrutarem do espaço, zona churrasqueira com mesas, zona com relva, atividades aquáticas, bar de apoio e claro WC.
Sinalética do que se pode fazer ou não, em que não se deve usar guarda sois- nas duas horas em que lá estive não vi ninguém a fazer esse controle. E também não entendo como é que estando a passar pela situação de pandemia, às 12h as casas de banho estavam num estado que nem é bom lembrar...
reviews/8/text:
Numa visita com família e amigos passar-se um dia excelente...
A praia apesar de muita gente tem boas condições. A muitas diversões para todos Paddle bord, gaivotas, insufláveis na água... E a preços bastante acessíveis.
Vale a pena visitar..
reviews/9/text:
Um espaço muito agradável, com mesas, grelhadores, ideal para pic-nic's.
Praia fluvial com equipamentos de lazer para adultos e crianças.
Recomendo.
reviews/10/text: É uma praia fluvial vigiada com parque de estacionamento e muita afluência, ou não fosse uma praia que se situa muito perto de um grande agregado urbano (cidade de Braga). Se quiser ter um bom local para estacionar e também para "montar o estaminé" para o piquenique, convém que nos fins de semana se apresse e chegue muito cedo ao local, se não tem de andar a negociar espaço...eheheheh. O espaço é bom, tem bares de apoio e entretenimento para os mais novos e também para os graúdos (escorregas no rio, gaivotas, etc). É uma boa praia com bom apoio para piqueniques. As casas de banho de apoio são boas e limpas para um espaço com tanta afluência. No dia que lá estive vi as senhoras a limpar ao longo do dia. Um bom espaço para um dia voltar a repetir.
reviews/10/title: Se quer fazer um piquenique e molhar-se este é um bom local
reviews/11/text: Mesmo às portas de Braga, banhada pelo rio Cávado está a bela praia de Adaúfe. Tem imenso espaço verde e bons lugares para banhos desde os mais velhos até aos mais novos. Recomendo toda a gente a visitar, está inserida numa paisagem deslumbrante.
reviews/12/text: A praia fluvial é simples mas muito importante nas épocas mais quentes do ano pois sendo uma cidade sem mar é importante ter locais de água para arrefecer a temperatura.
reviews/12/title: Passeando e conhecendo cidades em Portugal.
reviews/13/text: Para um dia de calor, nada melhor do que passar o dia na Praia Fluvial de Adaúfe. O espaço é maravilhoso: bem arborizado com churrasqueiras, estacionamento. No alto verão, fica bem cheio, mas nada que atrapalhe a visita. A água do Rio Cávado é BEM gelada (para quem está acostumado com as águas mornas do Brasil). Durante os meses de julho a setembro, o bar fica aberto para atender aos turistas e tem controle com salva-vidas também. E um detalhe: animais de estimação não são permitidos.
reviews/14/text: Fui visitar em 26/05/2019, um domingo com temperatura elevada para a época. É um local bastante agradável, com muita área verde na margem do tranquilo rio Cávado. Na época balnear há vigilância, aluguel de caiaques e o único bar local funciona durante o dia. O espaço é bastante grande, com churrasqueiras comunitárias, algumas mesas com bancos de pedra e muito espaço para as pessoas estenderem suas toalhas. A água estava bem fria, mas isso não impediu os mergulhos de muitas crianças e adultos. Em finais de semana com dias quentes, o local é bem procurado mas a área disponível para estacionamento não é grande o suficiente, fazendo com alguns carros tenham que estacionar a uma distância considerável. Mas isso não estraga o passeio.
reviews/14/title: Bom local para lazer, principalmente em dias quentes
reviews/15/text:
A praia fluvial de Adaufe fica localizada em Braga.
É um espaço ao ar livre muito agradável onde pode fazer piqueniques, passear ou tomar banho na praia fluvial.
reviews/16/text: très belle plage fluviale près de Braga, vous pouvez y faire du canoé, du paddle, du pédalo (tarif 2 € pour 30 min de paddle)
reviews/17/text:
Desconhecia e fiquei a conhecer recentemente este espaço nos arredores da cidade de Braga. 
Tem imenso espaço para mostrar tendas, estender mantas, toalhas. Tanta coisa e com o rio ali bem perto.  Local vigiado com nadador salvador e dispõe de um café para quem não leva nada de casa. 
A água estava um pouco fria mas não é normal. Habitualmente água de rio sempre é mais quente. 
Gostei bastante do ambiente e peca apenas numa coisa, tem pouco estacionamento. Quando fui os carros já estacionavam na estrada nacional ficando bem distante da praia. 
Foi um dia de enchente mas há imenso espaço para isso melhorar
reviews/17/title: Um belo espaço bem perto de Braga
reviews/18/text: Em um dia quente, nada melhor para se refrescar e se reenergizar que este lugar! Entrada gratuita. Com acesso à pessoas com dificuldadede de mobilidade. Não estávamos de carro, portanto dependíamos de transporte público, é só ir até o centro de Braga e pegar o autocarro 44, pronto! Este te deixará "na porta" deste pequeno paraíso. Ótimo local para crianças, para fazer sup (stand up padle), canoagem... ou simplesmente descansar à sombra. Ideal para fazer pic-nic. Apesar de possuir um estabelecimento no local com lanches deliciosos e com preços acessíveis. Com certeza voltaremos!
subcategory_ranking: #35 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Avenida Central 98, Braga 4710-229 Portugal
name: Basilica dos Congregados
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Braga and Guimarães Full Day Private Tour from Porto
ranking: #15 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #15 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text:
This “Basilica” has been built in the 16th century, although only got completed in the 20th century.
His construction began in the year 1703, and was blessed on October 27 from the year 1717, although the towers and statues to be placed in the respective niches on the façade still need to be built.
These works were to be carried out in the 20th century, with the west tower having been completed in the year 1964, 
On March 15 of the year 1975, the Holy See granted the Church of the Congregates the title of Basilica Minor. Not bad at all to have a short visit during your walk in the historical center.
reviews/1/text: This is one of the churches that I liked the most. Baroque architecture very well preserved. Totally recommended.
reviews/2/text:
A very impressive church on Placa de Republica. It towers over the streets and the facade is just beautiful. 
Inside too I loved the iconography with he gold gilt inlaid altar and the arched clockwork of the ceiling. Not as intricate as some other churches in Braga but impressive nonetheless. 
A wonderfully tranquil and serene place  ideal for contemplation.
reviews/3/text: Stunning and well-located church that possibly holds the most architecturally satisfying interior of any temple in the city (which, given the odds, is more than a minor victory).
reviews/4/text: The façade church is quite imposing on the garden’s lateral in front of the Arcade. Going inside one is probably expecting more, mainly because the temple is granted with the basilica title. Although interesting and harmonious it doesn’t deserve a detour; go in if you are walking by. Enjoy!
reviews/4/title: Very harmonious church but not magnificent enough for the basilica title
reviews/5/text: Basilica dos Congregados is another church in Braga. The thing with these buildings is that they are really worth stopping for and looking at, for at last a few minutes. The architecture is usually great and the interior is quite often amazing. We came across this 18th century church while wandering the streets of Braga. The outside is quite good and really lovely. However the interior is not what you might expect, as it is mostly rather plain, with a few exceptions. It deserves a bit of a look in, if you are that way inclined, and a few minutes will do just fine.
reviews/6/text:
The church was built in the 18th century and was designed by Andre Soares.

Admission is free and the interior is quite attractive. But with so many beautiful churches in Portugal, this one is rather average by comparison.
reviews/7/text: The interiors are not very impressive if you're looking into art but it's very beautiful if your looking to see something high and leaving with the impression of seeing something big.
reviews/8/text: another beautiful church in Bragda.  The sculptures on the fiscade are magnificent as well as those inside.
reviews/9/text: Another cool church in braga (and there are many churches), right next to a very nice plaza. Great arhitecture.
reviews/10/text:
Located at the Avenida Central, this church was made as our landmark and the plaza. There was a church service when we arrived and we went inside. No camera needed while the church service went on. 

It was needed to take note of the place because somewhere near was our car parked. I have to be alert of else we will be lost.
reviews/10/title: the first church we attended when we arrived.
reviews/11/text:
Eucaristia às  22horas.Um padre muito simpático  e acolhedor.
Obrigada Sr Pde Paulo Terroso pela sua homilia.Muito bonita.❤❤
reviews/12/text: Αυτή η ιδιαίτερα εντυπωσιακή εκκλησία, βρίσκεται στο κέντρο της πόλης, στην εκτεταμένη πλατεία Δημοκρατίας (Praça da República). Η κατασκευή της ξεκίνησε στις αρχές του 18ου αιώνα σε σχέδια του αρχιτέκτονα André Soares, με έντονη την κυριαρχία της αρχιτεκτονικής Μπαρόκ, αλλά ολοκληρώθηκε μόλις το 1964, οπότε διαθέτει και έντονες ροκοκό και νεοκλασικές αρχιτεκτονικές επιρροές. Το κυρίαρχο στην εξωτερική της εικόνα είναι τα δύο ψηλόλιγνα καμπαναριά της, ενώ την πρόσοψή της κοσμούν δύο όμορφα αγάλματα αγίων, φιλοτεχνημένα από τον γλύπτη Manuel Nogueira da Silva. Το ιδιαιτέρως φωτογενές εσωτερικό της εκκλησίας, είναι όμορφα διακοσμημένο με εξαιρετικά αγάλματα και θρησκευτικές σκηνές.
reviews/13/text: A Basílica dos Congregados localiza-se na Avenida Central e seu estilo é barroco/rococó. É mais um Patrimônio Nacional.
reviews/14/text: É uma Igreja na capital das Igrejas. É engraçda por dentro (dentro do que as igrejas podem ser engraçadas), se forem a Braga para ver Igrejas então tem de ver esta. Se já viram as outras dezenas de igrejas de Braga e estão fartos de Igrejas, podem passar esta à frente.
reviews/15/text:
Den här basilikan ligger lite diskret på Praca da Republica, men förtjänar uppmärksamhet då dess fasad anses vara ett av vackraste exemplen på portugisisk barock. Basilikan började byggas 1703 och invigdes 1717, men då var den bara halvklar och bland annat saknade torn. Inte blev det bättre av att alla katolska ordnar förbjöds i början av 1800-talet. Först i mitten av 1950-talet tog arbetet med att göra färdigt kyrkan fart. Tornen stod klara 1958 medan statyerna hissades upp till sina nischer i fasaden först 1964.
Vacker? Absolut, både utanpå och inuti, och väl värd en omväg från den stimmiga gågatan.
reviews/16/text: Basílica imponente y vertical encajada entre edificios más bajos y modernos en un lateral de la plaza de la República
reviews/17/text: Outra grande experiência em Braga. Arquitetura linda. No momento em que fomos, estava com locais em restauração.
reviews/18/text:
É um belo e imponente edifício cuja sua construção remonta ao início do séc. XVI, sendo uma obra da autoria do arquiteto André Soares (1720-1769).
A conclusão da sua construção terminou apenas na segunda metade do séc. XX e a expensas do benemérito António Augusto Nogueira da Silva (1901-1976).
Em 15 de março de 1975 a Santa Sé concedeu à Igreja dos Congregados o título de Basílica Menor.
Está classificada como Imóvel de Interesse Público desde 1993.
reviews/19/text: 街の中心のレプブリカ広場の横の公園沿いにある教会です。ファサードには２つの塔があり、像も立っていました。内部はポルトガルの教会は黄金でギラギラしている教会が多いですが、こちらはそこまでギラギラしてなくて普通にきれいな教会でした。
reviews/19/title: レプブリカ広場の近く

address: Rua Doutor Rocha Peixoto 4700, Braga 4700-033 Portugal
name: Termas romanas de Maximinus
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Showcooking on a Biological farm
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Braga – A Timeless Treasure
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Roman Braga - Half day - Cultural tour
ranking: #29 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #29 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: A good opportunity to see some of the remains of Roman Braga. Well presented and interpreted. A short walk from the current City Centre.
reviews/1/text: Outdoor, covered bath site. Small indoor museum with an excellent multilingual video. The video give 3d walk-throughs of the various rooms of the bath, which helps you visualize what you are seeing at the excavation.
reviews/1/title: Interesting opportunity to see the layout of a bath
reviews/2/text: The Roman Thermae of Maximinus is a worthwhile site to visit if you have never seen anything like it before, or if you are a  "Roman tragic", like some of us! This is the remains of a 1st century complex, where there were public Roman Baths. In those days, Braga's namesake, Bracara Augusta, was a provincial Roman capital, and a very important centre. The site is not as well preserved as other similar sites, but that is a common problem in many countries around Europe where the Romans had set foot. What remains is quite interesting and with a bit of imagination and more information, you could bring back to life those amazing times. Keep in mind that excavations are continuing. As for getting there, it is not too difficult. If you have a map, or a phone app, then you should no real problems finding the site. It is quite close to the train station, about ten to 15 minutes walk at the most.
reviews/3/text:
Braga is a very old city and you should expect some sights from the past.
These baths are not magnificent but they are an honest work and are well preserved.
Ticket entrance is affordable and you won't regret.
reviews/3/title: Roman bath small but well preserved
reviews/4/text: I like it's well preserved and you have an explanation video about how it functioned. I think the city should have more activities over there!
reviews/5/text: Theres no show stopper to see here, its a bathhouse with hypercaust but there are no mosaics its all housed in an impressive metal cover with a walkway . its somthing to see but you wont spend much time here before moving on
reviews/6/text: The ruins are a little out of the way. I wasn't able to get the video presentation to work but there were some information boards to help understand what you were looking at. The theater next to the site was also interesting, although it has only been partially excavated. If you enjoy Roman ruins then I would suggest visiting and getting the combined ticket that also gives you access to the Fonte do Idolo.
reviews/7/text:
Definitely an interesting place to visit in Braga. On arrival you are shown a video telling you about the ruins and what they would have looked like. You then visit the ruins to see for yourself.

The site is a bit difficult to find and could do with a little more signage.

Worth a visit.
reviews/8/text: OK, this place is actually a ruin, but if they continue to take care of it the way we found it... It is worth a visit, but a little more information would help to really see what it must have been almost 20 centuries ago. We couldn't see the film (normally closed on Sunday, but exceptionally open because of the Bracara Augusta festivities), which is supposed to be OK. For 1€85 we don't complain, but our expectations were not fully met
reviews/9/text: The site was a little difficult to find.  While we may not have had the best map, our search was made all the more difficult when even the locals, having no idea where it was, repeatedly pointed us to and from the area!  Yes, it is a major historical find and the City has made an impressive effort in excavating, preserving and exhibiting the ruins but, unless you are a true student of archeology, there is just not a lot there.  If you are covering all the Braga sites and have the time then go check it out.  Otherwise, take a pass.
reviews/9/title: Major search to find for a minor experience
reviews/10/text: This place was only found by accident    There is a walk way and a section in many languages which explains it all and what has been found.  Worth a visit in town and quite neat some of the other sites.
reviews/11/text: Excavated Roman baths, under cover. Theatre still being excavated. Good video reconstruction of baths (available in English). Pleasant and helpful staff. Worth a visit if in Braga. Admission a few euros, 50% discount for seniors
reviews/12/text: Extensive excavated remains of Roman baths in Braga. Good introductory film in English at the visitor centre.
reviews/13/text: The Roman baths of Braga are worth a visit, but they are not more or less impressive than other Roman ruins of this nature throughout the vast Roman empire. Whether or not the adjoining Roman theater can ever be reconstructed is a major question.
reviews/13/title: roman site on the way to presentability
reviews/14/text: Great to see this developing site.  It's very interesting and will become even more interesting as archaeological and restoration works continue.
