Very pleasant and helpful staff here.  They couldn't have been nicer or more attentive and had an incredible grasp of the facts about the site.  The video overview is very useful.  The cost is modest too.  Highly recommended.
reviews/15/text: although the potential and the good will, this place is still under excavations and work, and it is simply not ready for serious touristic visit
reviews/16/text:
Um pouco afastado do centro mais turístico de Braga, estas ruinas de um edifício termal foram descobertas em 1977 e desde então tornou-se no espaço mais amplo da cidade, que recorda a ocupação romana a partir do séc. I.
Na minha visita, fui muito bem recebido pela funcionária de serviço e pude assistir a um vídeo de cerca de dez minutos sobre como estava organizada essas termas públicas e a sua evolução ao longo dos anos seguintes.
Depois segui para a visita às ruinas e achei muito interessante o espaço exterior, que tem a forma de um anfiteatro e que possivelmente será alvo de escavações nos próximos tempos.
Visitei as antigas Termas Romanas de Maximinos com um bilhete que também deu para visitar a Fonte do Ídolo, em frente ao Palácio do Raio, no centro da cidade, e que custou 3,35€.
Estas termas romanas estão classificadas como "Monumento Nacional", desde 1986.
reviews/16/title: Termas Romanas do Alto da Cividade
reviews/17/text: Oltre a dei resti romani, molto interessanti per chi è appassionato o studioso in merito, non c'è da vedere. una bella salita però non manca mai.
reviews/17/title: Resti romani e una bella salita.
reviews/18/text: Des thermes romains, c'est toujours attirant. Ceux-ci sont assez bien conservés. Dommage, il y a peu d'explications. Cela mériterait d'être mis en valeur.
reviews/19/text:
Las termas romanas del Alto da Cividade comenzaron a excavarse en 1977, continuándose las campañas hasta 1999. Se trata del edifico más amplio conocido de Bracara Augusta; se construyeron sobre un edificio anterior a principios del siglo II d. C., y fueron reformadas alrededor del año 300, quedando sin uso poco después, durante ese siglo IV.
Abiertas al público desde 2004, en la campaña de 1999 se descubrieron junto a ellas los restos de un teatro que se supone también construido a principios del siglo II.
subcategory_ranking: #29 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Avenida Liberdade,697, Braga 4710-251 Portugal
name: Theatro Circo
ranking: #21 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #21 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text:
This “Theatro Circo”, which we have seen so from the outside, is located at Avenida da Liberdade n.º 697, in the parish of São Lázaro, city and municipality of Braga.
It is considered the most prestigious theater in Braga, and who is classified as a Property of Public Interest since the year 1983.
reviews/1/text:
The Teatro Circo was first inaugurated on 21 April 1915 when everything around it was only dirt roads and very few houses.
Following a storied history that included the first talking films, operas and public performances, the building was restored by the municipal council of Braga, and reopened in 2006.
It can be visited.
reviews/1/title: The Most Famous and Old Theatre in Braga
reviews/2/text: Theatro Circo is a really lovely building, inside and out. It was built in the early 1900s and opened in 1915. It underwent some renovations in more recent years and you will love your visit if you stop by for a look. It's worth it.
reviews/3/text:
It’s robust nice building from outside, absolutely stunning inside with such a beautiful detailed decor. 
We went there to see the show of flamengo and really enjoyed ourselves. 
Worth a visit.
reviews/4/text: It's a very well preserved building, with recent reforms but respected a lot the original! A very good place to visit! Not just the outside but you need to see the inside!
reviews/5/text: We could not find the chance to attend a performance.. Bu the building was very nice... And I hope I will have a chance to see a performance.It is situated in the heart of the city and very easy to locate it.
reviews/6/text:
A beautiful building that houses a stunning auditorium that has to be seen to be believed.  There has obviously been a bit of a refurb in the last ten years which means that the seats are comfy, but there is a silly looking wooden barrier/fence around the perimeter of the stalls that looks well out of place.  

I picked the opening night performance - or Gala - for the San Joao Festival.  You should be happy that it was a one off, and you can’t make the same mistake I did.  There was one choir that made the grade - the rest of it was amateur hour interspersed with lots of back-slapping of local officials, volunteers and performers.  And an MC that gave new meaning to the word “underwhelming”.  Excruciating.
reviews/6/title: Do see the inside - but pick your show carefully
reviews/7/text: Beautiful theater which well fits the city of Braga with it architecture both inside and outside. :)
reviews/8/text:
i went for a beautiful concert and i really enjoyed the place.
i got late and people were really nice and helpful
the seats were old and the room is absolutely charming
reviews/9/text: If there is any spare time, this theatre is definitely worth a visit or even better going to see some performance. We saw lovely flamingo show and meanwhile enjoy the stunning interior which I wouldn't have expect from outside, when the building suggest more robust design.
reviews/10/text: Um sítio de visita obrigatória para quem visita Braga. A sério, não te vias arrepender. Confia em mim.
reviews/11/text: Στο πανέμορφο ιστορικό κέντρο της Μπράγκα, στη Λεωφόρο Ελευθερίας (Liberdade), συναντάμε και το Theatro Circo. Με ιστορία πάνω από έναν αιώνα, αφού κατασκευάστηκε το 1915, αξιοποιείται για μια μεγάλη ποικιλία πολιτιστικών εκδηλώσεων. Έχει φιλοξενήσει παλαιότερα παραστάσεις τσίρκου, ενώ σήμερα συνέδρια, κινηματογραφικές προβολές, εκθέσεις, μουσικά φεστιβάλ, εκπαιδευτικά προγράμματα και εορταστικές εκδηλώσεις. Το 2006 έγιναν εκτεταμένες εργασίες συντήρησης και αναπαλαίωσης, ενώ διοργανώνονται και ξεναγήσεις με επίσκεψη σε όλους τους εσωτερικούς χώρους του. Δυστυχώς, το βρήκαμε κλειστό καθώς γίνονταν εργασίες στην πρόσοψη του κτηρίου.
reviews/12/text: Com o grande impulso que teve as artes cênicas em Portugal no início do século XX, o antigo teatro da cidade de Braga, o Teatro São Geraldo, não atendia às necessidades da população. Por esta razão, em 1906, nasceu a idéia de uma nova casa de espetáculos. Casa esta que foi inaugurada em 21 de abril de 1915. Sua sala principal comporta quase 900 pessoas e tem 4 pisos e belíssima.
reviews/13/text: Theatro Circo edifício bonito ,lindo numa zoza central de Braga,com uma fachada espectacular.Recomendo.
reviews/14/text:
Selvom man gerne havde set en international forestilling her og dermed bygningens indre, hvis lejligheden og tiden havde tilladt det, så er bygningen alligevel værd at stoppe op ved som et pragteksemplar i art nouveau stil, og hvor man bestemt ikke er i tvivl om, at det gælder et teater.
Der er mange fine detaljer i facaden, som alligevel fremstår ret enkel.
reviews/15/text: Superbe édifice aussi bien l’extérieur de granit gris est sobre que l’intérieur de velour rouge circulaire est surprenante pour un théâtre 🎭 .
reviews/16/text: Me gustó la fachada modernista del teatro de Braga y por la noche se permite intuir (gracias a la iluminación interior) sus magníficos salones (y especialmente sus lámparas).  En ciertas ocasiones, como me ocurrió a mi, en su fachada se proyectan un vídeo mapping que vale la pena ver.
reviews/17/text:
Arquitetura singular, destaca-se no centro da cidade, bem restaurado.
Imponente.
Mas como já se trata de uma antiga construção o conforto para ver espetáculo não é dos melhores e a programação as vezes é alternativa demais.
reviews/18/text:
Estive nesta sala para assistir a um concerto d’Os Quatro e Meia e gostei bastante. Alguns músicos já tinham referenciado e constatei realmente isso. Com um trabalhado muito interessante e um local muito bem preservado. 
Difere na beleza em relação a outras e tem uma acústica impecável. 
O staff que colabora nos eventos são muito dedicados. De referir que o concerto teve uma alteração e data e resolveram o problema com muita brevidade e simplicidade. Orientaram me para o lugar e desfrutei de um espectáculo com muita qualidade. 
Visitando Braga, incluam este local para visitar, aconselho.
reviews/18/title: A sala mais bonita de Portugal
reviews/19/text:
Estive nesse teatro pela primeira vez em novembro para assistir Os Guardas do Taj.
Fiquei apaixonada pelo lugar, lindo lindo lindo
Não imaginava que tivesse tanta beleza, mesmo o prédio sendo bem imponente.
Se estiver em Braga vá ao Circo, sempre tem ótimas opções de espetáculos.
subcategory_ranking: #21 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: N101 634, Braga 4715-165 Portugal
name: Parque de Sao Joao da Ponte
ranking: #44 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #44 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: It’s cute but not well kept. The cafe over there has limited options. More alcohol than drinks and snacks. I was expecting to try pastel de nata over there but not available.
reviews/1/text: This park didn't seemed very special to me. It didn't seemed very well kept either. You can skipt this if you visit the city.
reviews/2/text: Although this is a very important place in the city, it has lots of places that are completely abandoned. It has lots of beautiful corners nevertheless.
reviews/3/text:
Muito perto do centro da cidade, o Parque de São João da Ponte tem um bonito coreto, uma capela, várias estátuas em pedra, mesas/cadeiras para piqueniques, alguns bancos de jardim, caminhos para corrida informal, etc.
É um belo local para relaxar, passear calmamente, apesar do trânsito rodoviário nas imediações ser muito intenso, mas que não se nota quando se passeia pelo parque.
Está sempre aberto, porque não tem vedações.
O estacionamento automóvel é gratuito nas imediações e relativamente fácil de conseguir.
reviews/4/text: Muito bom para descontrair um pouco, longe do reboliço da cidade . Local aprazível com um lindo lago. Tem tb um café restaurante muito engraçado mas que está, muitas vezes, fechado.
reviews/5/text: Parque engraçado para dar umas voltas, passear em familia ou ficar a ler um livro, a dois passos da Rodovia.
reviews/6/text: Lindo na primavera! Parque agradável para uma caminhada e ainda tem a capela de Sao João no Parque Sao João anexo. Tem um restaurante de frente para o lago e parquinhos infantis que agrada os pequenos e os adolescentes. Recomendo fortemente para quem tem crianças
reviews/7/text: El sitio en sí mola, pero horrible que en el camping permitan que la gente ponga la música altísima durante toda la noche e incluso por las mañanas. Los baños no hay por donde cogerlos, y las duchas menos. Lo mejor, la piscina.
reviews/8/text: Parque bem amplo e arborizado além de bastante locais para descanso e conversa que tem fácil acesso.
reviews/8/title: Passeando e conhecendo cidades em Portugal.
reviews/9/text: 散歩兼ねてこちらを訪れました。公園の真ん中には、聖ヨハネ礼拝堂もあり心が自然と落ち着き、気持ちも優しくなれました。池や野外ステージも備えています。またプールもあり夏にはさぞかし、たくさんお人が訪れ賑やかになることでしょう。
reviews/9/title: 礼拝堂は洗礼者聖ヨハネに捧げられている
reviews/10/text: Parque de São João da Ponte está localizado no centro da cidade de Braga, ao final da Avenida da Liberdade. Ótimo lugar para um fim de tarde e descanso. Para quem gosta de fazer caminhada, correr ou até mesmo andar de bike, há a Ecovia bem do ladinho.
reviews/11/text: Parque São João da Ponte,é uma das zonas que se pode passear e descansar,sendo uma zona arborizada.Perto das termas Romanas e junto ao museu de arqueologia.
reviews/12/text: Renovado e por isso mesmo muito mais apelativo. Reze, coma, passeie e descanse aqui mesmo muito perto do centro da cidade.
reviews/13/text: É um local emblemático da cidade, onde no dia 24 de Junho se celebram as festas de S. João/festas da cidade. Local com muitas árvores situado ao lado do antigo estádio 1.º de Maio e anexo ao parque onde se situa um lago para diversão e onde se podem desfrutar momentos de lazer agradáveis principalmente com bom tempo. Tem um restaurante bom, situado dentro do parque. Este local é ideal para gente de todas as idades crianças inclusive.
reviews/14/text: Espaço arborizado bastante agradavel. Tem um pequeno lago no interior do parque e um bar onde pode tomar algo e  abstrair-se de que está praticamente no centro da cidade.
reviews/15/text: É pequeno e tem um lago ao centro. Muito bom pra dar uma corrida. Tem um café e restaurante à beira do lago onde se pode sentar e tomar um lanche. Bom pras crianças.
reviews/16/text:
Parque de S. Joao, de S. Juan, localizado en la salida hacia Guimaraes en la carretera nacional, direccion estadio 1 de mayo, antiguo estadio de Braga. 
El parque es un lugar fantastico y lleno de encanto donde podemos localizar un iglesia del año 1600, pequeña, linda. Recomiendo su visita.
Hacen mercados publicos en est eentorno, y cuando la ciudad se viste de fiesta es zona concurrida. Al lado de algunos restaurantes conocidos en la ciudad: la Castanhuela, o El Lago.
En junio se hace una misa campal en este parque.
reviews/17/text:
Local onde a luz, a paz, a água, o verde e o chilrear dos pássaros se fundem, mas não confundem. 
Com um espaço onde adultos, crianças e animais podem andar à vontade, o Parque proporciona uma manhã ou uma tarde bem passada, na companhia de amigos ou da família... ou apenas sozinho/a. Na esplanada do café, a saborear um gelado, a refrescar-se do calor ou em frente a um chá fumegante, seja calor ou frio, a olhar para o lago, tudo se repensa ou tudo o mais se esquece!
Espaço agradável, agora bem cuidado e que, em boa hora, a autarquia recuperou!
reviews/18/text: O parque é um bocadito afastado de centro da cidade mas vale apena a visita. è muito bonito e vale a pena a caminhada até lá
reviews/19/text: Braga é uma cidade muito linda, mas além de igrejas e capelas, o Parque da Ponte merece ser visitado porque, além de muito bonito (pequenino), é aberto 24h e grátis.
subcategory_ranking: #44 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Braga 4700-308 Portugal
name: Largo Carlos Amarante
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Small-Group Braga Tour Including Transfer to Bom Jesus
ranking: #28 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #28 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: One of the most typical spots of Braga and totally worth it. Definitely a "must" if you visit Braga.
reviews/1/text:
My favourite place in Braga just for its beauty and laid back charm. 
The white Braga sign is here for the perfecr tourist snap. 
The incredible Igreja de Santa Cruz with its spellbinding golden altar is on one corner and the magnificent San Marco Church is at the far end. Lovely well kept grass and shrubs in the square, an absolute pleasure to relax in or walk around.
reviews/2/text: This is a really nice looking place. There are some green spaces around, in contrast to many other squares which are absolutely bare of any green. This is a historic area in the historic part of Braga. There is a church, Igreja de Sao Marcos and Hospital, as well as a shopping centre plus several other shops in the area. It's worth a look.
reviews/3/text: Μεγάλη, όμορφη και ιδιαίτερα φωτογενής πλατεία, στο ιστορικό κέντρο της Braga. Γύρω της συναντάμε κάποια από τα σημαντικότερα αξιοθέατα της πόλης, όπως το παλαιό μεγάλο νοσοκομείο de São Marcos, ένα τμήμα του οποίου έχει μετατραπεί σήμερα σε ξενοδοχείο, την εντυπωσιακής μπαρόκ διακόσμησης Igreja de São Marcos και στην πάνω δεξιά πλευρά της πλατείας την επιβλητική Igreja de Santa Cruz. Στο μέσο της πλατείας, περιστοιχισμένο από φροντισμένες πρασιές και παρτέρια, είναι τοποθετημένο συντριβάνι του 17ου αιώνα, ενώ ξεχωριστή τουριστική ατραξιόν αποτελεί το με μεγάλα άσπρα γράμματα logo της πόλης. Καθημερινά, μεγάλος αριθμός τουριστών συνωστίζεται μπροστά στο όνομα της Braga για μια από τις δημοφιλέστερες αναμνηστικές φωτογραφίες επίσκεψης της πόλης!
reviews/4/text: O centro de tudo.Muito movimentada por trabalhadores,população em geral e muitos turista..Ponto de partida para qualquer lugar em Braga.
reviews/5/text: Bella piazza scoperta per caso passeggiando verso la macchina, ovviamente scatta subito la classica foto ricordo con la scritta BRAGA. Sullo sfondo la facciata della Chiesa di San Marco (chiusa) e una curatissima aiuola curata da lasciare incantati, a dx la Igreja de Santa Cruz. Nella piazza troverete ragazzi/e che propongono un tour di Braga su tuk-tuk.
reviews/6/text:
Bonita y amplia plaza que acoge a dos de las iglesias mas características de Braga Sao Marcos y Santa Cruz 
Además, para una buena foto recuerdo, tiene el letrero con la palabra BRAGA en grande
reviews/7/text: Largo localizado mesmo em frente à Igreja de Santa Cruz, é um dos locais mais usados pelos turistas para fotos. É amplo, limpo, e existem restaurantes e cafés nas redondezas, os quais pode usufruir com extrema facilidade.
reviews/8/text: Es una bonita plaza donde puedes ver dos de las iglesias mas características de Braga Sao Marcos y Santa Cruz (esta última recomiendo visitar su interior porque es muy bello)
reviews/9/text:
É sem dúvida um dos pontos da cidade a ser fotografado, por aqui se encontrarem as conhecidas letras gigantes que dizem "Braga", letras estas tão comum nas cidades hoje em dia, que fazem as delícias dos turistas. 
Nesta praça estão duas importantes igrejas, a de Santa Cruz e a de São Marcos, um hotel, mas tem poucos estabelecimentos de restauração, entre outras atividades comerciais. 
A maior área deste largo é pedonal, havendo uma rua para trânsito rodoviário, com apenas um sentido.
reviews/10/text: リベルダーデ通りから一本入ったところにある広場です。広場にはサンタ・クルス教会と聖マルコ教会が建っています。広場の中央にはモニュメントがあり、その周りにはお花が植えられていてきれいでした。
reviews/11/text:
Bello o cattivo tempo, si fa fatica a non rimanere incantati davanti a questa piazza, senza dubbio la più bella della città.
Sullo sfondo la bellissima facciata della Chiesa di San Marco (inspiegabilmente chiusa).
Qui troverete la scritta BRAGA per la classica foto ricordo di rito
reviews/11/title: La piazza più bella di Braga
reviews/12/text: Une autre très belle place de Braga. C’est d’ailleurs sur cette place portant le nom de l’ingénieur et architecte portugais (né à Braga) Carlos Luís Ferreira da Cruz Amarante (1748-1815) que la ville de Braga a installé sa sculpture signature, le nom de la ville en lettres géantes blanches. S’y trouvent également deux importants bâtiments du patrimoine religieux de Braga : le complexe de l’Hôpital et de l’Igreja de São Marcos et la très belle église dédiée à la Sainte Croix (Igreja de Santa Cruz). Pour compléter le tout, une belle fontaine de granit en forme de fleur datant du XVIe siècle occupe depuis le début du XXe siècle le centre de la place (elle était située à l’origine à Campo da Vinha). Elle est surmontée d’un grand obélisque ornée de quatre poissons de la bouche desquels jaillissent de l'eau et repose sur une plate-forme à trois marches. Elle est entourée d'un petit espace vert abondamment fleuri et de quelques bancs de pierre pour s’asseoir.
reviews/12/title: La ville de Braga y a installé sa sculpture signature en lettres géantes blanches
reviews/13/text: Um Largo aonde se encontra o letreiro com o nome de Braga. Ao fundo encontramos a Igreja São Marcos. O logradouro tem o nome de um filho da Terra, Carlos Luís Ferreira da Cruz Amarante. Engenheiro e Arquiteto responsável por obras importantes, especialmente em Braga e no Porto, além do Palácio da Brejoeira, em Monção.
reviews/14/text: É um grande espaço no centro da cidade e não considerei ponto turístico mas é um local de onde podemos acessar diversas atrações.
reviews/14/title: Passeando e conhecendo cidades em Portugal.
reviews/15/text: Dit is een zeer mooi en centraal gelegen plein. Vele bezienswaardigheden in de onmiddellijke omgeving. Het is er ook altijd relatief rustig.
reviews/16/text: カルロス・アマランテ広場は、ラウンド・アバウトになっています。広場には聖マルコ教会と聖十字架教会が建っています。広場には白い大きな“BRAGA”のサインボードが印象的でした。
reviews/16/title: 旅行者には絶好の撮影スポット
reviews/17/text: Letreiros com o nome das cidades tornaram-se grande ponto de atração para turistas em todo mundo. E em Braga não é diferente. Este largo possui o letreiro com no nome BRAGA. Um grande fluxo de turistas movimenta este largo durante todo o dia.
reviews/17/title: Praça com um grande letreiro de Braga
reviews/18/text: Nosso hotel, o Vila Galé, é em frente a este largo, bem no centro histórico da cidade. Agora, a prefeitura instalou um letreiro com o nome da cidade, e faz o maior sucesso!
reviews/19/text: Bonito Largo com igrejas,fontes,jardim,tudo em redor é belo e merece ser admirado e fotografado.Zona imperdível.Recomendo.
subcategory_ranking: #28 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Praca do Conde de Agrolongo, Braga 4700-031 Portugal
name: Igreja e Convento do Populo
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Romantic tour in Braga for couples
ranking: #31 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #31 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: Beautiful azulejos, a fine example of the Portuguese craftmanship. Angels looks are worth the visit. Check opening times.
reviews/1/text:
The construction of this temple was started in the year 1596 on the initiative of the then Archbishop of Braga, D. Frei Agostinho de Jesus (de Castro). The construction of the entire complex took place from the 16th to the 19th  century. A large part of the building (including the façade) was rebuilt in the late 18th century.
With the extinction of the male religious orders (1834), the complex was transferred to the hands of the State, and the convent dependencies, from the year 1841 onwards, began to house an Infantry Regiment.
Since the year 1996, the premises of the convent have been one of the buildings of the Municipality of Braga. 
In 2020 and 2021, the church is under construction.
reviews/2/text: This church is located on Campo da Vinha square and probably you’ll walk by it while visiting the center. In that case enter it; although not being one of the most beautiful churches in Braga you can admire its harmony. Enjoy!
reviews/2/title: Although big it is not one of the most beautiful churches in Braga
reviews/3/text: Igreja e Convento do Populo is yet another of the nice churches which seem to be plentiful in Braga. It is not one of those huge and exciting buildings one would expect, but it does look  rather attractive and the interior of this 16th century construction is decorated with beautiful blue tiles! It is so lovely to look at. The church is right next to a Monastery which is rather old, and now belongs to the City Authorities. Also close by, about a couple of minutes away, is the lovely Museu dos Biscainhos.
reviews/4/text: There seems to be a church on every corner in Braga. This one is just around the corner from Biscaínhos palace. It is closed over the lunch hour but is worth a short stop inside.
reviews/5/text:
A sua construção, em conjunto com o convento, iniciou-se nos finais do séc. XVI e demorou mais tempo do que o previsto até ficar concluída.
Achei que esta igreja parece uma pequena catedral, pela imponência do interior, sobretudo do coro alto e pelas laterais assemelharem-se a pequenas capelas.
O seu nome tem origem na Igreja de Santa Maria del Popolo, em Roma.
reviews/6/text: No dia que visitei a fachada, que parece ser a parte mais bonita, estava bloqueada por uma tenda então não consegui ver direito. Por dentro a igreja é simples, mas vale a olhada.
reviews/7/text: ブラガにある修道院です。わりと大きな建物で、正面向かって左側には教会があり中に入れます。中に入ると壁にポルトガル伝統のアズレージョのタイルがあって、ポルトガルらしい教会だなと思いました。パイプオルガもありました。
reviews/8/text:
Si trova a poca distanza dell'Arco da Porta Nova. Attualmente (novembre 2019) la piazza antistante è occupata dalla struttura del mercato cittadino.
Facciata decisamente semplice, l'interno, più interessante, regala qualche spunto
reviews/9/text: L’église et le couvent (Ordre des Augustins) du Peuple (Igreja e Convento do Pópulo) sont dédiés à la Vierge vénérée dans la basilique Santa Maria del Populo sur la piazza del Populo à Rome, le monastère de Sainte-Marie-du-Peuple, adjacent à l'église comme à Braga, était le premier couvent des Augustins à Rome. Ne dit-on pas de Braga qu’elle est la Rome du Portugal ? L’Igreja do Pópulo de Braga fut construite au XVIe siècle à la demande de l’archevêque Frei Agostinho de Jesus qui voulait y être inhumé. Celui-ci est décédé en 1609 mais ce n’est qu’en 1628 que son corps fut transféré dans un tombeau en bois lequel fut déposé dans une niche de la chapelle principale de cette église. À l’origine, le style artistique et architectural de l’église était plutôt influencé par le maniérisme, mouvement en vogue à l’époque suivant la Renaissance, soit de 1520 à 1580. Mais les restaurations apportées au XVIIIe siècle, notamment sur la façade, furent plutôt réalisées dans le style néoclassique. L’intérieur impressionne par la richesse de son décor : retable baroque recouvert de feuilles d’or et nombreux azulejos bleus et blancs que l’on attribue au céramiste Policarpo de Oliveira Bernardes (XVIIIe s.).
reviews/9/title: À intégrer dans votre circuit de visite des églises de Braga, la Rome du Portugal
reviews/10/text: Bien qu'elle est appelée l'église du peuple,elle offre une profusion d'autels et de décorations richement ornés,agréable a visiter et bien sûr comme d'autres au Portugal vous pouvez participer pour son entretien...et commencer par acheter le petit livre très complet et bien documenté sur son histoire...3€ !!!
reviews/11/text: Girando per Braga abbiamo incontrato questa Chiesa che ci ha incuriosito e siamo entrati,in stile neo classico con un altare in stile barocco e come tradizione portoghese decorata con le piastrelle (azuleios),davvero interessante.
reviews/12/text: Uma Igreja próxima ao estacionamento Parque Campo da Vinha. Seu nome refere-se a Santa Maria do Povo em Roma. Sua construção se arrastou por 3 séculos, do XVI para o XIX. É simples, mas bonita.
reviews/13/text: Van de buitenkant uit gezien lijkt dit een vrij sobere kerk. Daarentegen als je binnen gaat, bevat deze kerk een schat aan Azulejo taferelen. Een absolute aanrader.
reviews/14/text: Fonte do Campo das Hortas「オルタス・フィールドの噴水」を見学した際、大司教.フレイ・アゴスティーニョ・デ・イエスの依頼で造られた噴水を想いだし、この教会もあの大司教の依頼で献堂されました。聖堂には聖アウグスティヌスのアズレージョやがあります。また大司教がここで眠っています。
reviews/14/title: 偉大な大司教.フレイ・アゴスティーニョ・デ・イエスのお墓がある教会
reviews/15/text: l eglise est bien decorée , mais elle est sombre , dommage les azulejos sont beaux , un marché temporaire est installé au pied de l eglise.
reviews/16/text: Ao entrar uma atmosfera envolvente de muita paz. Um lindo lugar para meditar e descansar depois de longas caminhadas. Vale muito conhecer.
reviews/17/text: Esta igreja fica no centro histórico, em frente a Praça Conde de Agrolongo. O início de sua construção data de 1596, com fachada principal em estilo neoclássico. Seu belo interior é rico em detalhes.
reviews/18/text: Bonita Igreja com uma fachada excelente e com um interior também ele bonito.Localizada numa zona excelente e muito perto de outras atracções.Recomendo.
reviews/19/text:
Nella stessa domenica mattina e pomeriggio siamo entrati per vistare la chiesa ma vi era la santa messa in entrambe le volte.
Chiesa in stile barocco con cappelle laterali in cui spiccano sulle pareti degli interessanti azulejos che danno una profondità "azzurra" alla navata.
Interessante comunque.
reviews/19/title: Chiesa a doppio campanile con azulejos
subcategory_ranking: #31 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Campo das Hortas, Braga 4700-210 Portugal
name: Fonte do Campo das Hortas
ranking: #20 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #20 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: After a busy day, on a long trip, or early in the morning to tune in for the great day, take a chance to admire the parks, fountains, and architecture of Fonte do Campo das Hortas! Lovely and beautiful place!
reviews/1/text: This area is outside the center of the city and for me was very nice. This fountain is in a very green and well kept park.
reviews/2/text: Outside the city center, just before the Arco Da Porta Nova (city's doors), you'll find a nice spot to relax in-between the crowds :)
reviews/3/text: This is a really lovely baroque fountain in amongst a beautiful garden setting full of wonderfully maintained trees, plants and nice flowers. The water feature is also good and the area is a welcome place where you can stop for a while, rest and recharge your batteries!
reviews/4/text: It is a baroque fountain in the Field of the Gardens, next to the Arch of Porta Nova in the middle of the garden.
reviews/4/title: A baroque fountain in the Campo das Hortas
reviews/5/text: A very relaxing place to be, specially at the end of the afternoon but I would like to see some historical explanations about the square. I think the city needed to put their something for people to read just for us to know what are we visiting.
reviews/6/text: Very pretty fountain in the center of town in the middle of a big park.  Nice design, nice water feature.  One of the city's focal points.
reviews/7/text: A pleasant fountain in the middle of a square with some park area around it.  Near the center of town.  Pleasant, but not a must.
reviews/8/text: Se amid beautiful gardens this fountain is a popular tourist attraction. Originally supplied water to residents of the old city.
reviews/9/text: Όμορφο συντριβάνι, στο κέντρο της ομώνυμης τριγωνικής πλατείας, απέναντι από τη δυτική πλευρά της εμβληματικής Arco da Porta Nova. Είναι ένα συντριβάνι που γίνεται όλο και λεπτότερο όσο ανεβαίνει ψηλότερα και διαθέτει τρία διαφορετικά επίπεδα. Περιστοιχίζεται από μια καταπράσινη πλατεία, γεμάτη φροντισμένα παρτέρια με δέντρα, θάμνους και λουλούδια. Κατασκευάστηκε το 1594 με διαταγή του αρχιεπισκόπου D. Frei Agostinho de Jesus και με κατασκευαστή το λιθοξόο Manuel Luís. Η αρχική του θέση ήταν στην ανατολική πλευρά της Αvenida Central, για να μεταφερθεί στη σημερινή του θέση το 1914.
reviews/10/text:
År 1594 beordrade ärkebiskop D. Frei Agostinho de Jesus bygget av en storslagen granitfontän, tillika vattenkälla. Den har haft olika placeringar undre åren, men står sedan 1914 i parken framför Casa Grande just utanför Arco de Porta Nova. Den är verkligen både storslagen med tre våningar av vattenutkastare, en massa dekorationer och överst en armillärsfär och ett biskopskors.
Gammal och riktigt vacker att se på, värd en rejäl omväg.
reviews/11/text: Se aprecia menos de lo que gustaría porque hay una especie de quiosco delante (si lo miras desde el arco)
reviews/12/text:
É um belo chafariz do final do séc. XVI. 
Feito em granito, antes de vir para o Campo das Hortas, esteve colocado noutro sítio da cidade e aquando da minha passagem por aqui, estava com água corrente, o que o torna mais belo.
Está neste local desde 1914.
reviews/13/text:
Se arrivate a Braga in treno con buona probabilità sarà la prima cosa che vedrete della città.
Da qui partirà la vostra visita al centro storico
reviews/14/text: Cette fontaine a été réalisée par le maître maçon Manuel Luis en1594 à la demande de l’archevêque de Braga Dom Frei Agostinho de Jesus (1537-1609) pour décorer la place Sainte-Anne (Campo de Santa Ana). En 1910, elle a été déplacée au centre d’un espace jardin (Campo das Hortas) faisant face à l'Arco da Porta Nova où elle fut placée sur une base octogonale en escalier. Construite dans le style maniériste, elle est composée un grand bassin circulaire en granit surmonté d’une colonne pyramidale comportant deux bols décorés de figures animales, suivis d’une sphère armillaire (instrument composé de cercles emboîtés permettant de représenter certains mouvements des astres) et d’une croix en métal. Une très belle fontaine dans un très beau jardin.
reviews/14/title: Une très belle fontaine dans un très beau jardin.
reviews/15/text: Fonte e jardim simples, que conseguiram resistir e chegar anos nossos dias, uma boa sala de visitas de Braga
reviews/16/text:
Bonita plaza donde tienes varios de los restaurantes mejor considerados de la ciudad, y muy cerca alguno más excepcional.

Difícil aparcar pero no imposible.
reviews/17/text: Numa ida para a estação de caminho de ferro parei para ver esta fonte que em tempos vi muito degradada e que agora me parecia estar arranjada.E estava,Ficou melhor porque o jardim onde está também está mais condizente com os outros jardins da cidade.Ainda por cima,está mesmo encostado à entrada na cidade( Arco da Porta Nova).
reviews/18/text: Uma fonte no Campo das Hortas, no final da rua do Souto, depois do Arco da Porta Nova. Um local agradável em Braga, para relaxar e apreciar a bela fonte.
reviews/19/text: Está a las afueras del casco histórico de Braga y me pareció francamente normalita (en otras palabras sin nada que destacar).
subcategory_ranking: #20 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Avenida da Liberdade 1, Braga 4715-387 Portugal
name: Posto de Turismo de Braga
ranking: #23 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #23 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: Very nice people as all portuguese people. They gave me a map and explained a little bit about the city.
reviews/1/text: Good place to start, if you want some information and a map of Braga. We did. And it is in the centre, which is good as well. They were friendly and nice.
reviews/2/text: They put up with my confused state, gave me a map, found out where I was staying and told me how to get to it but, me being me, I went a different way - but still found it.
reviews/3/text: We came across the Tourist office while walking around Praca da Republica. The staff were quite helpful and provided us with lots of information about the best [laces to see and how to get there. We also got a reasonably good map which helped in identifying places. The Tourist office is always a good place to start your visit in any new place.
reviews/4/text: Picked up a god map oh historic Braga which would have helped had I had it at the beginning of my exploration. The tourism office is very central on Praça República and Ave Da Liberdade
reviews/5/text: Very well informed and reliable employees. Also, very kind, a nice place to go and see what Braga has to offer.
reviews/6/text:
Im not often visiting tourist information centers as I dont have good experience with the information they provide (f.e. in Athens).
Fortunately here the employees knew their job, gave me accurate information and everything was provided fast and with a smile. Thanks!
reviews/7/text: We stayed on the same street as the Tourism office so we walked by it every day. The hours were terrible. It seemed like we could never catch it open. When we finally found it open, the attendant inside was the absolute rudest person in Braga. But we love Braga and there are very few rude people. This woman said that she did not have any maps of Braga, no maps of northern Portugal nor any maps of Portugal. She said that she did not have any discount or combination tickets for the attractions locally. I was looking at a local map under glass at another part of the counter when I saw her open her drawer to give the next customer a map. The drawer was full of maps and information on attractions. I approached again while the other customer was still there and the attendant did give me a map, reluctantly. Not a very friendly place.
reviews/8/text:
We could'nt do without their assistance. Guide, instructions and leaflets were much needed in this tour. 

But not all the time we went to ask them information. So we made use of the map and other information.
reviews/8/title: Our great help for this tour in Braga.
reviews/9/text: Began as a post office and the exterior of the building is still there but over time a local mayor purchased it and spent a fortune turning it into high class shops retaining the original wooden staircase but when he lost his position the new mayor changed the rules and stopped any business from moving into any of the shops and it stands empty today except for a gym upstairs and a bar. Well worth seeing.
reviews/10/text: As we wandered up the main street we came across this building which was worth taking a couple of pictures off
reviews/11/text: maps from the city, information about  museums, tours offer, restaurants info, cultural agenda and general help.. a good starting place..
reviews/12/text: Go there and get some info, this will help you to plan your visit more efficient, saves time & money
reviews/13/text: Meertalig personeel. Brochures eveneens. Centraal gelegen in het hart van Braga, in een karakteristiek gebouw. Leuke winkel met lokale producten - geen voedsel.
reviews/13/title: Wat wil je weten over Braga en haar evenementen?
reviews/14/text: Για κάποιον που επισκέπτεται πρώτη φορά την πόλη και δεν ξέρει τα αξιοθέατά της, εδώ είναι ένα καλό σημείο να ξεκινήσεις. Βρίσκεται στο κέντρο, επί της Praça da República, στην αρχή της Avenida da Liberdade. Θα σας προμηθεύσουν με χάρτη της Braga και με υπομονή και ευγένεια θα σας παράσχουν συμβουλές-οδηγίες για να επισκεφθείτε τα βασικά αξιοθέατα. Επίσης μπορείτε να ζητήσετε συμβουλές και πληροφορίες για ολόκληρη τη Βόρεια Πορτογαλία και τον τρόπο να οργανώσετε την επίσκεψή σας και σε άλλες πόλεις και αξιοθέατά της. Ζεστοί άνθρωποι, θα σας κάνουν να νιώσετε άνετα και φιλόξενα!
reviews/15/text: Precisei ir ate o posto para encontrar uma rua q procurava e fui muito bem atendida, os atendentes são muito receptivos e educados.
reviews/16/text: Braga turistbyrå håller till i en lokal högst upp på Avenida da Liberdade precis vid Praca de Republica, ett perfekt läge som den som kommer ny till staden. Här fick vi ett trevligt bemötande och bra information om stadens intressanta historia. Att Brage utsetts till ”Europas bästa resmål 2021” kom som en överraskning, men förvånar inte. Den här delen av Europa är sorgligt underskattad av svenska turister. Vilken synd att detta inträffar just under ”pandemiåret” 2021.
reviews/17/text:
Para obter informações que não aparecem online, o Posto de Turismo de Braga informou-me do que precisei de saber.
A localização é a ideal, a principal área turística da cidade. As duas funcionárias presentes foram simpáticas e cordiais.
Fica no topo da Avenida da Liberdade.
reviews/18/text: 旧市街中心部のレプブリカ広場にあるので立ち寄りやすかったです。ブラガの街の情報が少なかったので、ここでもらった地図が便利でした。世界遺産のボン・ジェズス・ド・モンテへのバス乗り場の場所なども教えてもらいました。
reviews/19/text: L’édifice de l’Office du Tourisme de Braga (service inauguré en juin 1937, très bel édifice restauré en 2000) occupe un emplacement de choix à l’intersection de l’avenue centrale, de l’Avenida de Liberdade et de la très belle Praça da Republica (stationnement souterrain) avec sa magnifique fontaine. Service et documentation (cartes, tours guidés, bus pour le sanctuaire de Bom Jesus, etc.) en plusieurs langues dont le français. Ouvert tous les jours entre 9h et 18h (fermé entre 13h et 14h). Une visite qui peut s’avérer rentable sur le plan de l’efficacité. Merci pour les informations et le sourire.
reviews/19/title: Une visite qui peut s'avérer rentable en efficacité. Merci!
subcategory_ranking: #23 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Rua dos Bombeiros Voluntarios, Braga 4700-025 Portugal
description: The D. Diogo de Sousa Museum of Archaeology works on the support of archaeological research, conservation and promotion of regional archaeological sites and artefacts through display and educational activities. The museum is open to the public since June 2007 in a fantastic new building with roman ruins preserved ‘in situ’.The permanent exhibition starts in the corridor at the entrance with a brief explanation of the museum’s history followed by the collection from the Palaeolithic to the Early Midle Age. Most part of the exhibition shows how Bracara Augusta (roman town Braga) was integrated into the Roman Empire, the urban development of the city, the organization of public and domestic areas, the roads and the nearby necropolises and the religion in roman and paleo-christian times.
name: Museu D. Diogo de Sousa - Museum of Archeology
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Braga and Guimarães Full Day Private Tour from Porto
photo/caption: Provided By: Museu D. Diogo de Souza
ranking: #22 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #22 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: A nice place to visit on a rainy day.  The staff are super kind and the exhibits are well displayed and labeled, showing a number of ancient Roman jars and glass fragments.  There is a panel describing regional petroglifos, yet we wished there was much more.  Downstairs in the building is a collection of Roman mile marker stone pillars.  Outside on the cafe patio you will find the unlabeled stairs, under an awning,  leading down to the non-colorful mosaic (brown & white tile).  It is admirable how well the museum has preserved these items from Braga's past.
reviews/1/text:
23/6/22 Thursday late afternoon

We three middle aged British guys had some time to explore this museum. Unfortunately the nearby Roman Baths were closed because of the festival.

We crossed the giant concourse to enter the modern building and pay our €3 each for the museum.

To the right of the cashier’s desk was the first room full of Roman and Greek artefacts well lit and presented with English translations.

Passing the cashier’s desk you go along a long corridor to enter the main museum of displays and then downstairs to some more. All very impressive with some excellent models. 

We knew there was a large mosaic in the museum but there were no big signs. We were looking through a temporary exhibition of Disabled sports people and I asked my friend where the mosaic was. A worker overheard me and took me outside by the restaurant/cafe (restaurant was only open for lunch) and showed us an unlabelled ramp to the mosaics. Down we went to find the large underground square with an exhibition round the walls. The signs to this major attraction were really bad! We had a look around there four sides, a video was being shown in a room of something but there was no interpretation. The mosaic had little interpretation in Portuguese and none in English…such a shame! 

We then wandered through a children’s play and pupils’ study area, up the stairs and left. 

Altogether a good place to go to learn a free things about the area but there was not enough English translations of some important pieces and displays.
reviews/1/title: Great museum which should inspire potential archeologists. Big actual in situ mosaic is down a ramp overlooked by cafe
reviews/2/text:
Well worth a visit 3 Euros. This is a well organized collection of materials from Braga and the nearby Roman Bath and Theater. The collection contains some nice and unusual items like a Celtic helmet, gold Torcs and glassware.

There are VERY FEW labels. Instead, information would come from a purchased booklet. This is a weakness of the museum.

The museum is four rooms, one of which is an underground room with a large mosaic floor.
reviews/2/title: Celtic and Roman materials from Braga
reviews/3/text: Very nice museum with 4 exhibitions rooms where you can see the archaeological findings from the area and find out more about the Roman settlement. The gentleman at the desk was very very kind. The mosaic is  quite degraded unfortunately
reviews/4/text: My partner and I visited this museum after a trip to the tourism centre in central Braga. It costs €3 per person for entry with a range of discounts provided for students and over 60s. The price was very reasonable for what lay within. The museum had numerous interesting artifacts about Roman Braga. It provides an undeniable oust of culture and history to provide an insight into the significance of Roman Braga. More information on the exhibits would have been desirable but the lack of information can lead to historical predictions and hypotheses being made as you progress through the exhibits. The staff were amazing and had a wealth of knowledge, if any questions were had. Definitely worth a visit.
reviews/5/text: Museu D. Diogo de Sousa is quite a nice museum . It is actually built in the centre of what used to be the Roman City of Bracara Augusta, that is ancient Braga! There are even some original objects and other major artifacts dating from that time. You probably will not find the wealth of exhibits and accompanying information that you would come across other major museums, but that is something that might get fixed in the future, hopefully. The artifacts displayed are quite interesting but much more detailed and accessible information would help the visitors. The Cafeteria is good with a wide choice of offerings and reasonable prices.
reviews/6/text: I'm one of those who believe that museums ought to be free. I was told this was but it wasn't. I have no special interest nor do I have sufficient understanding to warrant paying to go in. There are some parts which are open to non-paying visitors, but they didn't do anything for me, nor did the building itself. What was more interesting was the commemorative structure just before the museum, titled "Movimento Perpétuo", which I supposed was influenced by the ancient arches of the city. See photo.
reviews/6/user/user_location/name: Las Palmas de Gran Canaria, Spain
reviews/7/text: The building is nice and the collection is also very interesting but it really seems it's abandoned by the authorities. Lack of information, the way they display the information it's not very friendly for a regular visitor. Also, the roman tiles are in a really bad shape, full of humidity. They really need to have more support.
reviews/8/text: Lover of archaeology and Im Disappointed with this one. Lack of information is so frustrating even though it has cool and interesting objects.
reviews/9/text: Braga is a city of beautiful architecture and design...how could its newest museum be such a poorly designed mess?  The approach is so ugly and unwelcoming. Tiny display cases with even tinier type line the entryways. The mosaic house is in an unmarked location our friends missed. .we only saw it because a guide saw us entering an off-limits space (with a wide open door) and redirected us. Many unlabeled display cases.
reviews/10/text: The museum is a little bit out of the town centre but is walkable c. 1km. The outside and layout is kind of modernist in intention. After getting your ticket you walk down a long corridor to the first rooms but I found the articles on the walls too small to read properly even squatting down a bit. The thrust of the modern is reflected in the minimalist explanations and designation of artefacts. The artefacts though are pretty good. However it would be nice to have had some explanation of the roman inscriptions of the stone plinths which were impressive. There are small guide notebooks on each floor but I could only find one (I was alone in the museum) but again had a real problem working out a) what exhibits they referred to and b) disappointed at the absence of any further explanations or background to the exhibits which was a shame as some were worthy. I only found out about the outside access to the roman ruins of a house by asking at reception whether I had missed anything. Similarly I had to ask where one of the key exhibits was (blue decorated silver saucer) and had to return and squat down to admire its beauty. It is a good museum but is let down mainly by the absence of background and explanations on what are in fact good displays. Didn't try the cafe as I was the only one there and it didn't seem to be open.Perhaps bad timing.
reviews/10/title: Great exhibits let down by lack of information
reviews/11/text: I am tempted to recall the old advertising for the V&A in London: "Ace cafe with quite a good museum attached".  The museum is more than quite good (as is the V&A!) and had some particularly good models of Roman life in Portugal.  The cafe was clearly a place patronised by locals and who could blame them!  For 6.50 euros the lunch was many courses long with tasty hot dishes and wine or other drinks included.  If one dessert wasn't enough, there was a baking tray of baked apples (delicious) for seconds.
reviews/11/title: Nicely laid out with information in English and great cafe
reviews/12/text: It's like a cantina in nature but a very decent restaurant to have lunch when you are pressed for time.
reviews/12/title: Good, fast and always with a treat
reviews/13/text:
Very nice museum!
Good exposition of arqueology of Braga, activities very interesting for kids and a nice restaurant!
reviews/14/text: don't forget to start or end your visit at the really nice cafeteria with a daily menu of simple dishes from northern portugal. very affordable and a comfortable place for a break. lady at the entrance reception said 80% of visitors (presumably locals) come just for the lunches!
reviews/15/text:
The museum is spacious and modern, people who work there are very friendly and if you go on a Sunday morning it's even free. I'm not an archeology enthusiast myself so I cannot say anything about that but even I had some things there that caught my eye for longer than I thought would be possible.

It's just a short walk from the center so I'd recommend looking around the area also.
reviews/16/text:
Clean, spacious and modern museum, interactive, lots of information, great reconstructions of several Roman buildings that once stood in Braga. Good museum shop, don't forget to go outside and visit the basement with the Roman mosaic.

After a visit to this museum (not in the centre of the city unfortunately, but near the remains of the Roman bathhouse!...) you will certainly be inspired to go to the tourist information to get the map with all the Roman features of the city.
reviews/16/title: Good starting point for an archaeological tour of Braga
reviews/17/text:
After many years of delay the Braga Museum of Archeology finally opened 4 years ago. That is why it may not show up in some guidebooks. 

It is by no means a big or first rate museum. This is not the British Museum. Still Braga was once the capital of the northern roman province of Gaelicia, an important commercial city and was well connected by 5 roman roads that are still used to this day. Getting to know this roman past is part of understanding and enjoying Braga. If you have a longer stay in town or just love history like myself I do recommend this museum. 

1) Do request to see the introductory video (in Portuguese but you can figure out they are talking about finding and fixing archeological discoveries). Also in the patio of the museum is the entrance to a Roman house discovered when they built the museum foundations.

2) Sundays entrance is free until 2 pm. Otherwise its something like 2-3 Euro entrance. 

3) Nearby is a roman thermal bath with a video explanation also worth visiting. 

4) Around town they are roman houses, walls and a fountain idol to be visited. All part of the urban landscape. Beneath the train station you can find a pre-roman steam bath !
reviews/17/title: Interesting museum and worth a visit of you extra time in Braga
reviews/18/text: Museo moi interesante e se es galego, fundamental tamén para comprender o que no seu momento era parte do mesmo territorio, a Gallaecia e o Reino de Galiza. Como apontamento, quizais precisa máis paneis para comprender o que temos alí, especialmente os guerreiros galaicos e todas as aras atopadas.
reviews/19/text:
Se siete a Braga probabilmente ci farete un salto perché non c'è moltissimo da vedere in città e il museo costa solo 3€.

Il museo è piccolino ed ha il suo apice nei mosaici romank (il cui ingresso si trova nel cortile interno, un po' nascosto). Il museo è anche relativamente ben organizzato, anche se con poche descrizioni, ma offre veramente poco. Fatta eccezione per una collezione frutto di donazioni private, il resto sono cianfrusaglie che sembrano lo scarto di altri musei.
reviews/19/title: Costa poco, ma vale anche poco
subcategory_ranking: #22 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Avenida Central 118 124, Braga 4710-229 Portugal
description: A rare exemplar of civilian baroque architecture in Braga, Casa Rolão is 250 years old. It is a house full of stories and classified as a "public interest building" since 1977. It has 3 floors and a beautiful garden with a terrace. Casa Rolão merges its architectonic heritage with a contemporary concept.
name: Casa Rolao
ranking: #33 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #33 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: The bookshop has a rear garden that is quiet. The cafe serves a lovely salad, sandwiches etc. Staff are very nice too.
reviews/0/title: Great lunch in the bookshop cafe
reviews/1/text: This baroque manor house is situate on the lateral side of the garden in front of the Arcade. Entering the building on your right-side you have a bookshop with several well decorated rooms. Cross all those and enjoy a drink in the back garden while you do your readings. Enjoy!
reviews/2/text: A great building with lots of different and unique types of stores. A great library, vintage stores and all. O definitely recommend it if you're looking to see more than religious Braga.
reviews/3/text: This is a beautiful Old building on the outside. It faces the park on the main square. The inside has a few businesses that are open, but it looked like they we working on the interior.
reviews/3/title: Beautiful exterior- they are still working on the inside.
reviews/4/text: O prédio no exterior muito bonito porém no interior degradado e em péssimo estado de conservação (passei pelas escadarias até o 2º andar), tem alguns estabelecimentos mas a meu ver não de interesse turístico. Destaque para a livraria acolhedora no térreo (100° página), tem refeição no local e um café, funcionários atenciosos e educados.
reviews/5/text:
É um edifício em estilo rococó, construído na década de 1760 para residência de um comerciante bracarense de seu nome Tomé Rolão.
No piso zero podemos ver uma livraria, no piso 1 existem 3 lojas e no segundo e último piso, quatro diferentes espaços, sendo um deles destinado a exposições.
Visitei apenas os pisos zero e um, e não achei um local convidativo, porque por dentro o estado de conservação não era o melhor.
Por fora chama a atenção e está localizado em zona turística da cidade.
Não é aconselhável a pessoas com mobilidade reduzida ou em cadeira de rodas.
reviews/6/text: La casa estaba cerrada, pero la librería merece la pena verla. Se trata de una librería antigua, donde te puedes tomar un café y dispone de jardín. Puedes encontrar libros de muchos idiomas y cuenta con buena atención por parte del personal.
reviews/7/text: O prédio é lindo, de fácil acesso, já que fica na parte central da cidade, bem perto da praça da república e possui uma livraria maravilhosa dentro, que é a 100 páginas, com seu café também bem agradável. Passaria horas na livraria, que conta com opções de presentes descolados também. Vale uma visita.
reviews/8/text:
Destaca en medio de varios edificios bonitos en una de las avenidas principales de Braga.

La biblioteca está bonita también.
reviews/9/text: Um espaço multicultural em Braga. Além de livraria e local de exposições, encontramos um café. Tudo num prédio belíssimo e muito bem conservado. Vale a pena a visita nesta obra belíssima do século XVIII.
reviews/10/text: A Casa Rolão é um prédio datado de 1758 e possui uma bela fachada. No térreo possui uma livraria bastante concorrida - a 100 páginas. É um edifício que foi reabilitado e de fácil acesso e fica na Avenida Central bem em frente a Praça da República.
reviews/10/title: Passeando e conhecendo cidades em Portugal.
reviews/11/text: ここは、アヴェニダ・セントラル公園沿いにあります。ローラン家は絹の生業で18世紀に財をなしました。お屋敷の建築様式は、バロックとロココの折衷です。ユニークなファサードは脳裏に焼き付きました。
reviews/11/title: ユニークなファサード
reviews/12/text:
Magnifique immeuble baroque qui abrite au des de chaussée une très belle  librairie  dans laquelle on peut déjeuner soit en intérieur, soit en extérieur car elle possède un  jardin au calme à  l'arrière. 
Au premier étage,  se trouve l'atelier et boutique d'une styliste qui a une vraie personnalité  que l'on retrouve d'ailleurs dans la coupe de ses vêtements  mais également  dans le choix  des matières, magnifique!
Et en face, un brocanteur, endroit magique où  l'on découvre de vieux objets déco  typiques du Portugal, et plein d'autres curiosités...Super aussi avec les enfants!
reviews/13/text: A Casa Rolão é um dos mais interesantes edifícios de arquitetura civil de Braga, que tem no rés-do-chão uma livraria muito interessante, a 100 Página, que além de vender livros serve refeições ligeiras. A reabilitação arquitetónica do edifício é interessante, tal como tem no piso superiores lojas alternativas.
reviews/13/title: Um dos mais interessantes edifícios do estilo barroco de Braga.
reviews/14/text: Neste local funciona algumas lojas que vendem produtos de Portugal e uma livraria bem simpática. O prédio data de 1758 e tem uma linda fachada. Fica na Av. Central, em frente a Praça da República!
reviews/15/text: Casa Rolão,com uma bonita fachada,charmoso e com detalhes bonitos e bem localizada numa zona excelente de Baga.
reviews/16/text: 바로크 양식의 건물로 레푸블리카 광장쪽에 있어요. 건물이 1977년에 국가기념물로 지정되었다고 합니다. 1층은 서점과 카페테리아를 운영중입니다. 브라가에서 가장 오래된 서점이라고 하는데 그것까진 잘 모르겠고 내부는 꽤나 현대식입니다.
reviews/17/text: Dette er bestemt en af de mange bygninger på avd. central og avd. liberdade, som man bør iagttage med dens barokke facade. Dette giver også anledning til at nævne, at der på de to avenuer findes et meget stort antal arkitektur stilretninger repræsenteret og fra nyere tid art nouveau, art deco, og tidlig funkis.
reviews/18/text: Imaginada por André Soares esta casa apresenta uma arquitetura característica do século XVIIII. Já que está à porta visite a livraria Centésima Página
reviews/19/text: Na Casa Rolão você encontra bons produtos com design português, além de uma simpática livraria. O prédio tem um certo charme. Vale a visita.
subcategory_ranking: #33 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Rua do Raio São José de São Lázaro, Braga 4710-922 Portugal
name: Fonte do Idolo
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Roman Braga - Half day - Cultural tour
ranking: #38 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #38 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: Well done, indoors. This site is the location of a Roman era fountain shrine to local Gods. The accompanying video is excellent and in Portuguese, Spanish and English. The video shows and explains the various inscriptions and reconstructs the shrine.
reviews/1/text: For entering it you must pay an entrance fee. It is probably worth for the explanations and the way it is musealized than for the monument itself. Enjoy!
reviews/2/text: It's a lovely place, small but full of history. And it's so ancient! I would prefer to see the fountain with water again, I think they should put it with some water just like Conimbriga roman city.
reviews/3/text: theres not much to see, but a video puts what there is to see in context. With imagination you could see that it was once impressive and important. worth a visit as its not expensive
reviews/4/text: There isn't much to this site but what is there is interesting. The video does help as there isn't a lot of other information beyond a pamphlet that you are provided with. Only the wall and the rock that the etchings are on remain, so you do not get the sense of how it would have been 2000 years ago. It is in a large modern building but the video does help. You can get a combined ticket that also grants you access to the Roman Baths.
reviews/5/text: I recommend going here if you need a cool place to sit for a bit.  It's only 1.85 euro. It is the remains of a pagan fountain that was once on site when the city was under Roman rule.
reviews/5/title: Not much going for it, but it doesn't cost much
reviews/6/text: This is a difference type of museum where they have built an elaborate building to house the old well and set up a video to show how they believe it was constructed and explain the script still evident on the sculpture. Well worth a visit.
reviews/6/title: Excellent place to see and the only well still in existence in Braga.
reviews/7/text:
Almost nothing to see, just some rocks with a little water. There is a short video about de fonte, but it is really like a 10 year old giving a presentation at school.
Not worth the 1,85 euro entrance fee.
reviews/7/title: Nothing special except the historic place
reviews/8/text: It is from the 1. century, most probabaly roman fountain. There is a video and good explanations about the history. You should spend too much time, but you can fell the history.
reviews/9/text: Small sacred spring site now enclosed in a modern building but worth hunting out. Very atmospheric and staff very helpful.
reviews/10/text: Looking to get a short hop off the main tourist route?  The Idol's Fountain is a unique, partially conserved ruin.  The video explanation is in several languages and, to me, is less important than the look and feel of the ruin.  Whether the statue and niche were a devotee's concern or the decorative wall inside a house is debated.  No one will ever know.  Study it for the placement depth.  Realize that a house or a road were that far below what is now Braga.  Imagine sitting near the spring and enjoying its cool waters on a hot day.  Sublime!
reviews/11/text: This fountain dates back to the 1st century AD; it contains a mix of Celtiberian and Roman features and the place nowadays is very well preserved and of easy access. You will need no more than 30 minutes to visit it, which is perfect for travelers with a lot of things to see but not much time to spend. In the Fountain you will be able to find videos and texts which will also help you understanding the context of the Fountain and the early Roman period in Portugal a bit better. Recommended especially for those who love History, Art and Archaeology.
reviews/12/text: Fonto do Idolo is a small historal site in the city of Braga from the beginning of the first century. It is one of the best prepared sanctuarys I have seen during my travels. Many details can be found.
reviews/13/text: Een detail van een grotere fontijn uit de Romeinse tijd. Braga, vroeger Braganca, zou gesticht zijn door de Romeinen, maar in werkelijkheid waren er al nederzettingen. Buiten de stad, die toen ommuurd was, werd een groter plantsoen met kunstwerken gemaakt. Dit is een restant, nu midden in het centrum. Er wordt entree geld gevraagd, maar dat is een klein bedrag.
reviews/14/text: É uma ruína Romana, a não ser que sejas um apaixonado por arqueologia, não vale a pena entrar. Mal se consegue definir as estátuas.
reviews/15/text:
Praticamente em frente ao Palácio do Raio, podemos visitar este local que apresenta no seu interior mais vestígios milenares da ocupação da atual cidade de Braga.
Como vi num panfleto que me ofereceram no local, isto é um santuário rupestre de origem pré-romana, dedicado à deusa indígena Nábia, intimamente ligada ao culto da água e da fertilidade.
Foi monumentalizado no início da fundação da cidade, por um imigrante chamado Celico Fronto, que mandou executar as esculturas e as inscrições visíveis na frente do santuário.
Posteriormente os descendentes deste imigrante renovaram o monumento, construindo um lago em frente à fachada da fonte.
Na minha visita pude assistir a um curto vídeo sobre a história desta fonte, que atualmente se encontra em avançado estado de degradação, deixando perceber que ali esteve em tempos uma estátua de uma figura humana com cerca de 1,10 metros de altura e algumas inscrições.
Entre a receção e a zona da fonte existem 14 degraus o que impossibilita a visita a pessoas em cadeira de rodas ou com dificuldade em subir/descer degraus. Não vi qualquer elevador.
Visitei este lugar comprando um bilhete conjunto (Termas Romanas da Cividade + Fonte do Ídolo) por 3,35€.
reviews/15/title: Fonte do Ídolo ou Tanque do Quintal do Ídolo
reviews/16/text: Non si vede nulla se non con la fantasia e con il volantino che viene fornito all'ingresso. Soldi buttati.
reviews/17/text: Une sculpture romaine qui a 2.000 ans ! Une belle émotion. Évidemment, puisque elle est en sous-sol, pas facile de la mettre en valeur.
reviews/18/text:
Visita obligatoria en el centro de Braga, a Fonte do Idolo. 
Se encuentra situada en el interior de un edificio cerca de la Avenida da Liberdade en el que puedes acceder por solo 90 céntimos si eres estudiante.
Además de ver la fuente, te ponen un vídeo sobre el origen, su emplazamiento y evolución en el tiempo.
Definitivamente, es una actividad muy interesante de ver al mismo tiempo que económica.
reviews/19/text:
La Fuente del Ídolo es un peculiar monumento edificado a las afueras de Bracara Augusta que muestra la romanización de las poblaciones indígenas conquistadas por Roma.
Probablemente sobre un santuario anterior, la fuente fue monumentalizada por Celico Fronto en el siglo I d. C. En la piedra fueron esculpidas una figura togada, a la izquierda, y, a la derecha, en una edícula con frontón triangular, un busto masculino. Son cuatro las inscripciones grabadas en la roca, dos de las cuales dan el nombre de Celico Fronto, natural de Arcóbriga –que estaría al sur de Lusitania–, dando otra el nombre de Tongo Nabiago, divinidad asociada a Nabia, diosa de la fecundidad habitualmente –como aquí– relacionada con el agua.
Entre 2001 y 2004 se hicieron unos importantes trabajos de musealización que permiten su visita, contextualizando el monumento. Por apenas 2 € bien merece la pena su visita.
subcategory_ranking: #38 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Largo do Paco, Braga 4700-314 Portugal
name: Largo do Paco
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Braga and Guimarães Full Day Private Tour from Porto
offer_group/offer_list/1/title: Small-Group Braga Tour Including Transfer to Bom Jesus
offer_group/offer_list/2/title: Private Tour to Guimarães and Braga, two incredible cities
ranking: #46 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #46 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text: Just in the center of the city, nect to the cathedral. Is a "must" if you visit the city and very typical architecture.
reviews/1/text: At the historic center of Braga, you will find the ancient "Palácio Episcopal de Braga" (literally, the palace of the archbishops of Braga). It was officially founded in the 11th century and, along the years, it has been built and rebuilt several times. The buildings on the Southern side of the palace, delimited by "Rua do Souto" and by "Rua Dom Diogo de Sousa", form a small square known as "Largo do Paço". At its center, a beautiful fountain, the 18th century "Chafariz dos Castelos". As a matter of fact, it is not exactly a square, but rather a patio, as no gardens or lawns or benches are seen. Since 1973, these buildings house the rectory of the University of Minho. A quick stop, a few pictures and you are done. Enjoy!
reviews/1/title: A small patio and an 18th Baroque fountain!
reviews/2/text: Largo do Paco is a public Square in the beautiful historic centre of Braga. It is part of the Episcopal Palace and of the local Minho University. The Square itself is really unremarkable, except for the beautiful fountain in the middle of this public space. The fountain is called Chafariz dos Castelos, or Fountain of the Castles. The buildings surrounding this are part of the Episcopal Palace belonging to the Archbishop. This might explain a few things! The fountain itself was not working when we visited, but it was lovely nonetheless. There are no trees or any greenery in the square, at least not when we visited. It was absolutely bare! Bear in mind that many squares in European cities are like that anyway, so that's probably no surprise! Perhaps the scene changes on special occasions. There are quite a few shops in the area, like restaurants, cafes, tourist shops and so on.
reviews/3/text: Πρόκειται για πλατεία στο ιστορικό κέντρο της Braga, η οποία περιβάλλεται από ένα σύνολο όμορφων ιστορικών κτηρίων, ενώ στη μέση της συναντάμε ένα συντριβάνι του 1723. Τα κτήρια αυτά κάποτε αποτελούσαν το Αρχιεπισκοπικό Παλάτι της πόλης, το περίφημο Paço Episcopal Bracarense. Σήμερα, το Αρχιεπισκοπικό Μέγαρο φιλοξενεί την Πρυτανεία του Πανεπιστημίου του Minho, τη Δημόσια Βιβλιοθήκη της Braga και το Δημοτικό Αρχείο.
reviews/4/text: Ärkebiskoparnas palats i centrala Braga består av ett myller av byggnader och husdelar i olika arkitektur. Idag har biskoparna flyttat ut och den västra husdelen har tagits över av det kommunala biblioteket, i nordost hittar man Santa Barbaras trädgård medan de södra byggnaderna tagits över av universitets administration. Här brer också ett torg ut sig, Largo do Paco, intill gågatan Rua do Souto. Torget, som är helt befriat från träd, cafébord, stolar och bänkar, domineras av sin fontän Chafariz dos Castelos, invigd 1723. På dagarna är det kalt och solstekt men på kvällarna lever området upp; fotgängare strövar förbi, caféer slår upp sina bord på gågatan och inte sällan spelar gatumusikanter.
reviews/5/text:
É a praça onde se encontra o Paço Episcopal de Braga e a reitoria da Universidade do Minho.
Esta praça, que fica ao lado da conhecida rua do Souto. tem como principal ponto de destaque o Chafariz dos Castelos, inaugurado em 1723.
reviews/6/text: ブラガ旧市街のメインストリートのソウト通り沿いに面している広場です。ブラガ大聖堂の斜め前あたりにあります。建物に囲まれていて、広場の中央には噴水が立っていました。
reviews/7/text:
La plaza es peatonal y empedrada, y recibe este nombre porque en ella se encuentra el Palacio de la República Bracarense(hoy sede de la Rectoría de la Universidad del Miño), cuyas tres alas delimitan el contorno de esta plaza.

En el centro hay una fuente que fue el emblema de la ciudad, apareciendo representada en sus billetes.
reviews/7/title: Plaza y fuente frente a la catedral
reviews/8/text:
Al estar en la calle principal del casco histórico te la encontrarás de camino varias veces.

La fuente y los edificios son sencillo pero el conjunto está bastante bien.

Tienes muy cerquita la catedral.
reviews/9/text: Bij een wandeling door het oude gedeelte kom je automatisch ook op dit plein terecht. Niet heel bijzonder, alleen de fontein is de moeite van het bekijken waard.
reviews/10/text: Um espaço bem no centro histórico de Braga, aonda encotramos o Chafariz dos Castelos. Local do antigo Paço Episcopal um edificação que teve grande relevância na História da cidade. O Paço foi sendo construído e ampliado por 6 séculos. Hoje a construção é considerado Imóvel de Interesse Público.
reviews/11/text: La plaza en si no tiene nada en especial si no fuera por la curiosa fuente que se encuentra en su centro.  Como curiosidad en su decoración hay tantos castillos como tiene el escudo de la ciudad (si no recuerdo mal son nueve).
reviews/12/text: 大聖堂から近くの宮殿の建物がコの字型に囲う広場です。雑草が少し生えているものの、完全に石畳で覆われていて草木がない、完全な人工的な広場です。
reviews/13/text: Imprescindible visita si estás en Braga, esta plaza cuenta con una bonita fuente en el medio llamada Chafariz.
reviews/14/text: Als je er toevallig langskomt is het mooi om te zien. In het midden van het U vormige gebouw staat een vrij grote, niet werkende, fontein.
reviews/15/text: 日本語なら、宮殿広場です。建物サンタ・バルバーラ公園の前に広がる広場です。ブラガの歴史的中心部に位置しています。かつては大司教の住居でした。今でも綺麗に整備されています。
reviews/15/title: 綺麗に整備された広場
reviews/16/text: Ao sair do jardim de Santa Bárbara dei com este bonito largo,antigo com uma fonte a conferir charme e beleza a este largo.
reviews/17/text: ポルトからの日帰りツアーで皆で通り抜けて歩いてしまいましたが、水が出ていなかったので皆さん注目していませんでしたが、噴水中央の彫刻が素晴らしです。
reviews/17/title: 噴水の中央の彫刻に注目！
reviews/18/text: Uma grande praça, sem árvores ou plantas. Apenas um grande chafariz no seu centro. Local interessante nesta cidade tão antiga.
reviews/19/text:
O Largo do Paço de Braga é uma praça (naqueles conceito europeu de praça: nada de árvores, jardins e raramente um banco pra sentar), que fica no coração do centro histórico dessa cidade portuguesa.
Está cercada por interessantes edifícios históricos, de arquitetura admirável, como o Paço Episcopal Bracarense e a reitoria da Universidade do Minho. Um dos seus lados, o de acesso a pedestres dá para a rua do Souto.
No centro da praça, está um belo chafariz, o Chafariz dos Castelos, que remonta a 1723, mas que é motivo de outra avaliação que eu já fiz. Passa lá pra dar uma olhada...
reviews/19/title: 10 minutinhos são suficientes pra você conhecer...
subcategory_ranking: #46 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Largo de Sao Tiago 47 Largo de Santiago, 47, Braga 4700-039 Portugal
description: Pio XII Museum has a vast inheritance in litica, numismatic, ceramic, textile, sculpture, painting and goldsmithery areas. In the Medieval Tower the history Braga is represented and the visitor is able to see the city from above. Visitants may also know a significant part of Henrique Medina's work, one of the big portrait artists of XX century.
name: Museu PIO XII
photo/caption: A HISTÓRIA DA HUMANIDADE CONTA-SE AQUI!
ranking: #34 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #34 of 119 things to do in Braga
reviews/0/text:
I really enjoyed my hour or so in this interesting, eclectic museum. Its hard to classify if actually. It starts off as an archaeology museum with paleolithic, neolithic a d bronze age finds, ancient weapons and such artefacts, then on to fragments of romanesque columns and the like and then to religious statuary and iconography.
Upstairs there's superb art gallery. I don't profess to know much about art  but I know what I like- and I liked this. 
A wonderfully friendly and helpful girl at the front desk made the visit so much better.
reviews/1/text: Very interesting collections and expositions! I really liked the building also and the employers were very kind. It's not in bad shape, it's actually very well preserved. Definitely recommend it.
reviews/2/text: It is interesting to have a view on things dated 250.000 years old and go along time until almost nowadays. We had also the painter Henrique Medina's exhibition, which we didn't know, and it was also interesting.
reviews/3/text: Gostei desse museu.  Super bem cuidado, lindo. A parte superior é maravilhosa com as obras de Henrique Medina. Não conhecia o artista e passei a admirar.
reviews/4/text: Πολύ αξιόλογο και εκτεταμένο μουσείο, για το οποίο δυστυχώς δεν είχαμε τον απαραίτητο χρόνο για μια πιο σωστή επίσκεψη. Ανακαλύψαμε ότι η έκτασή του και ο πλούτος των εκθεμάτων του απαιτούν να έχεις σημαντικό διαθέσιμο χρόνο, ώστε να πραγματοποιηθεί μια επαρκής επίσκεψή του. Βρίσκεται στο κέντρο της πόλης, δίπλα στον μεσαιωνικό Torre de Santiago, ο οποίος ήταν τμήμα των οχυρώσεων της πόλης και σήμερα ανήκει και αυτός στο μουσείο Pio XII. Στις αίθουσες του μουσείου, μπορείτε να απολαύσετε μία από τις σημαντικότερες αρχαιολογικές και θρησκευτικές συλλογές όλης της Βόρειας Πορτογαλίας. Μεταξύ των εκθεμάτων περιλαμβάνονται κεραμικά, νομίσματα, γλυπτά, κοσμήματα, πίνακες, λιθογραφίες, θρησκευτικά κειμήλια και υπέροχα διατηρημένα ρούχα εποχής. Ξεχωριστή θέση στο μουσείο καταλαμβάνουν οι πίνακες του Henrique Medina, που θεωρείται ένας από τους μεγαλύτερους προσωπογράφους του 20ου αιώνα.
reviews/5/text:
O Museu Pio XII foi fundado em 1957 e deve o seu nome ao Papa que estava em funções nesse ano. Está instalado num edifício que pertence à Arquidiocese de Braga.
Na primeira sala começamos por ver alguns objetos encontrados em escavações arqueológicas e no tempo da ocupação romana.
Seguidamente e com maior espaço destinado, temos a vertente religiosa, com arte sacra e bonitos objetos de ouro, onde destaco os pequenos crucifixos do séc. XVII e XVIII, entre outros.
Depois ao passar pela cultura oriental, gostei de ver as moedas chinesas com mais de 2700 anos.
Gostei também da exposição permanente de pintura de Henrique Medina (1901-1988), no piso superior, especialmente as pinturas de pessoas.
O interior tem boas acessibilidades para visitantes em cadeira de rodas, mas na entrada do edifício, vindo da rua, existem dois degraus o que torna inacessível a visita, sem ajudas para os subir.
É um museu muito interessante, mas achei que está pouco divulgado, também por estar um pouco afastado da zona mais turística da cidade.
A visita ao Museu Pio XII teve um custo de 2€. Comprei o bilhete conjunto com a Torre de Santiago, que fica em frente, os dois espaços por 4€.
reviews/6/text: Excelente local que todos devem visitar. Belo local de beleza de cultura e de conhecimento para todos. Visitem!!!
reviews/7/text: Trata-se de um Museu muito interessante, com bastantes antiguidades em exposição, e que também procura desenvolver a divulgação de artistas plásticos oriundos de Braga/ ou que viveram nesta cidade.
reviews/8/text:
ピオ１２世は第二次世界大戦中の法王で、ナチスへの協力者だとか諸説紛々で色々と歴史的な評価が分かれる人です。ポルトガル人だったけ？と思い入ってみました。

中に入ると、法王の遺物もありますが、どうもローマ時代の遺跡の上にある建物らしく、当時の遺物や、より遡った石器時代の遺物が中心でした。
reviews/8/title: 展示物は先史時代が中心
reviews/9/text: 館内は、旧石器時代から新石器時代まで、また青銅器時代から鉄器時代までの人類の栄華盛衰を物語っています。そして、陶磁器、ガラス、青銅と鉄、彫像と絵画、織物、宝石類などの多種にわたっています。貴重で豊富なコレクションを楽しむことができました。...
reviews/10/text: Eine sehr nette Portugiesin im Eingangsbereich, bemühte sich auf sympathische Art, sich verständlich zu machen. Neben archäoglischen Funden waren sehr beeindruckende Werke (meist Portraits) eines Malers zu bestaunen, dessen Namen mir jetzt leider entfallen ist. Ein zu besteigener Turm in unmittelbarer Nähe war gerade geschlossen, dennoch ein erfreuliches und denkwürdiges Erlebnis.
reviews/11/text:
O bilhete pode ser adquirido em conjunto com o bilhete para  visitar a Nossa Senhora da Torre que fica mesmo ao lado do museu. A exposição do pintor Medina foi o que eu mais gostei na visita, Tem peças diversas desde bustos em madeira a cruzeiros.
A visita a Nossa Senhora da Torre é mais interessante pela vista que tem, de resto a exposição que estava patente ao longo dos diversos pisos da torre não achei nada de especial.
reviews/12/text: Museu pouco interessante. Religioso e talvez por isso mais válido para os crentes. A destacar a visita À capela de madeira no edifício ao lado ,
reviews/13/text: Il Museo Pio XII è tra le cose interessanti da vedere a Braga. La collezione di reperti archeologici racconta il passato della città, con reperti risalenti al Paleolitico. Però le esposizioni che ho trovato più interessanti sono quelle di gioielli, ceramiche, sculture e tessuti del periodo medievale. Il clou è la salita alla torre medievale che offre una magnifica vista sulla città e sulla campagna circostante.
reviews/14/text: Compramos por 6€ la entrada que incluía el museo Pio XII, museo Medina, la torre y el tesauro (o algo así se llamaba. La verdad que no me valió la pena, si llego a saber que es tan poca cosa, no gasto ni un céntimo.
reviews/15/text: Estivemos no museu de arqueologia que já era suficiente!!! Tem poucas peças em exposição e pagamos 8 euros para 2 pessoas, na torre tem alguns terços apenas e tifoque se vê neste museu tem praticamente no museu de arqueologia que vale muito mais a pena!
reviews/16/text: O Museu Pio XII, é um museu bem singular. As amostras deste museu são terços, doados e adqueridos em diversas parte do mundo. Muito interessante.
reviews/17/text: Fundado em 1957, reune uma rica coleção de arqueologia e uma extensa coleção de arte sacra. Não deixe de conhecer a torre medieval (40 metros de altura), com das melhores vistas da cidade de braga. Vale a pena á visita.
reviews/18/text: Vale mesmo a pena visitar. Trata-se de um ambiente cultural muito acolhedor com uma iluminação soberba.
reviews/19/text:
Acervo de arte sacra e não só impressionante. Espólio de Medina interessante. 
Poderia ter mais explicações do exposto.
subcategory_ranking: #34 of 119 things to do in Braga

address: Praca da Republica, Braga 4700-306 Portugal
name: Chafariz da Praca da Republica
offer_group/offer_list/0/title: Romantic tour in Braga for couples
ranking: #36 of 119 things to do in Braga
ranking_subcategory: #36 of 119 things to do in Braga
